description:
Wonderful, delightful, beautiful, and tasty. That's what comes to mind when I think Playland. This perfectly placed pillar of powerful PM potions is a staple on the Polk Street corridor. 

Walking through the door means friends, family, and waves. Yes, a tidal wave of delicious cocktails, and friendly conversations. This is my goto place for a happy hour downstairs, or a private party upstairs. That's it baby, 'nuff said
author: Shawn R.

description:
Honestly my favorite place on Polk street. This bar has two stories and let me tell you.. the second floor is always a good time. Although it may get crowded through the night, the music is always relevant and fun! It's pretty dead around 10pm but once it rolls around 11, this place gets so packed it's hard to move around. There's four bars total (I think). Two upstairs and two downstairs. Drinks are standard prices, there's no cover for girls but I think it's a $10 cover for guys (depending on time and day I think?), all restrooms are downstairs. There's a fairly large dance floor, music videos are playing along with the music, and the DJ takes requests! Line does get out the door sometimes but it moves quick. 

Come here if you love dancing! Great vibes and I love it!
author: Amy L.

description:
My silly friend lost his phone the other night. We saw on Find My iPhone that the location was sitting somewhere on Pine/Polk so we called Playland the next day to see if it could have been left there. Reuben picked up the phone (outside of business hours) to ensure us it was. Along with my bag of groceries (yellow dragonfruits + golden kiwis, ain't cheap yo). What a relief. Thank god for the honest crowds + team at Playland.

I also ALWAYS have a great time at Playland. Definitely a spot I bring visitors to and they are never disappointed!

Love ya P'land.
author: Chantel Y.

description:
Great for dancing and for watching weird old music videos.

As other reviews have mentioned, it can get a little grabby but luckily most people we encountered were fine.

Definitely should have pregamed more, but will be back!
author: Hannah H.

description: Great spot to grab after work drinks or any night out! Judith whips up some delish cocktails behind the bar and the service is top notch. Anywhere from the perfect old fashioned to creative twists on some classics. Great ambiance, great people and great music as well. Fun welcoming atmosphere with great vibes. This place has been a fun spot for years and will continue to be a go to for my friends and I!
author: Christel G.

description:
A bunch of us were visiting the city from LA and Las Vegas to celebrate our cousin's 21st Birthday and Playland was her bar of choice. We arrived at about 11:30 on a Saturday night and the line was wrapped around the corner. We waited in line for about 20 minutes or so, no problem. Once we finally reached the door, I was a bit surprised when the bouncers told us that the guys in our group had to pay a $10 cover fee. Also, if there was a dress code here, I didn't notice it and it wasn't enforced because god forbid, guys were wearing jeans with Converse and girls were wearing Stan Smith's. It was a very casual and laid back vibe from the start. 

Once inside, a few of us ordered drinks from the cocktail menu on display. They were just okay, too sweet for my palette. The bartender making the cocktails didn't seem to be too familiar with the recipes as she kept having to turn around to refer to the list of ingredients on the wall.

Upstairs was complete pandemonium. It was extremely packed and hard to maneuver your way around the dance floor. Cramped would be an understatement. Once you find your spot, you're there for the rest of the night! I'm almost positive the building occupancy exceeded the maximum capacity for fire code enforcement! Basically, don't come here if you're claustrophobic. If you go to the bar, have fun finding your way back. Luckily, there's a small bar closer to the dance floor, but come prepared because that particular bar accepts cash only. Drinks weren't too strong, but they were cheap (IMO) compared to what I'm used to in Vegas! 

I liked the music when we first arrived. The DJ was playing TLC, Ashanti, and that Oye Mi Canto throwback. The crowd was chanting the words to every song that blared through the speakers, which I guess says a lot about the age group here. As the night went on, the music got progressively worse. I love me some Cardi B, but one can only listen to Bodak Yellow so many times.

Overall, I'd say we had a good time and enjoyed ourselves.
author: Jordan I.

description:
Overall the place is good. 
Different kind of music on different days, sometimes it gets really crowded and the public is all mixed. 
Drinks are okay. Staff is nice most times. 
A friend got her bag stolen once in there, so you better take care of your stuff.
author: Diana F.

description:
If you want to dance, Playland Bar is the place to go. The music is awesome and definitely gets you hyped. The DJ was open to song requests which made the night that much better as we sang along to our favorite songs. 

Visited Playland Bar as part of a pub crawl on Halloween night. As part of the crawl deal, certain drinks were $3 each which was awesome. The place was packed and the bartenders were overwhelmed with orders. Upstairs, there was only one bartender so it took a really long time to get our drinks. The place is kept clean. I saw the employees frequently walking around to grab empty cups.
author: Katie C.

description:
Be warned: You may get kicked out for dancing. Yes, that's right. The bouncers here are WAY too aggressive.

The bouncers walk up and down putting a flash light in your face and yelling at people.

My friends and I were jumping along to the music and the bouncer featured in the photo I've attached warned us that if we jumped again, we would be removed.

We weren't aggressively jumping on people - we were just putting our hands up and jumping to the music having fun. Shortly after, someone came up to us and said "that bouncer is a jerk he tried to kick us out too."

Per my previous place, this was my go to place on Polk. Never again.

The music is good and the people are fun. The bouncer though was absolutely terrible and I will avoid this place for now on.
author: Dylan R.

description: Horrible bouncer service. Too drunk to understand what is happening. Notice drink in hand. Horrible management. They cover for bouncers. Enforcing the law doesn't mean drink the confiscated shot. At least to my understanding.
author: Bored I.

description:
Really sketchy place. Avoid at all costs.

This past (and last) time I was here, as I waited for my girlfriend to finish using the bathroom, I stopped by the basement bar to grab a bottled water. The barmaid continued to ignore me and serve other customers as I waited patiently right in front of her. Finally, I got my water for $2.41. I typically would tip here, but I was upset with the service, and put an "X" in the tip line. About a week later, I noticed that my credit card was charged $3.41. I guess she had forged a fake $1 tip. LAME.

P.S. The service for table reservations is equally atrocious and the bathroom situation is a mess. On the bright side, the upstairs dance area is super fun if you're into overcrowded sausage fests!
author: Justin H.

description:
Really crowded and wild. If you're looking for a place to just dance you can check out the upstairs area here. It's a younger crowd definitely. Drinks didn't seem very strong, but at least they were made fast. After about 30 minutes the scene gets pretty old.

There's a cover for guys but girls are free.
author: Courtney N.

description: Thank you Morgan for the great drinks, you were a pleasure to chat with and we were impressed by your friendly service. Huge fan of the Calypso Old Fashioned. We will definitely be back again!
author: Benny D.

description:
Playland is the best. I don't even maintain friendships anymore I just show up here and hope for the best.

All the regular bartenders are tops. Shout out to Ali, Judith and Yuyulia in alphabetical order. Ina's being weird again. ;-)

Come on the weekday evenings. Friday/Saturday there's really no d
author: Randy R.

description: Perfect Monday Night spot to chill and meet people while you get some of those errands done that you missed because of Sunday Funday! Judith and Yulia  make you always feel welcome...and they have good taste in music!
author: Luis G.

description: FYI there's definitely a dress code. My guy friend got turned away for wearing shorts :(
author: Christine Y.

description: Racist POS bar.  We walked over here 10 mins ago and they let three of our white girl friends in and then denied my friend who is black because they said he pulled his jeans up on the way over in the cross walk....his jeans are skinny and fitted....so he was denied entry.  We waited for our girlfriends to come back out as a group of Hispanics went to go in and they started charging $5 and they said the front guys jeans were too baggy. They weren't baggy, they fitted normally...and as he said he was chubby and skinny jeans weren't his style.  This place is beyond racist and has terrible management.  The security guards said they were taking their orders from their owner in the camera below the sign (see below for stupid camera). If I could I would give this place negative 1 million stars for their racist ways!!!
author: Marie E.

description:
I was assaulted here on February 3rd. In the middle of the dance floor, a man grabbed my left breast. 

If you are looking for a place to confirm your suspicions that San Francisco is THE WORST city to go out in, ever, I would recommend Playland. If you are on the fence about the state of humanity and you're looking for something to push you over to a more negative view, Playland is the place for you.

If you value your bodily autonomy, steer clear.
author: Kat C.

description: Make sure you wear a belt! They wouldn't let one in our party because his pants were 'sagging.' Bye!
author: Earlene C.

description: I went with a group of 30 people for my birthday and had an awful experience. It almost ruined my birthday. The staff was rude to my aunt upstairs when she inadvertently sat in the VIP section and harassed her to get up right away. Two of my friends paid but they did not let him, they had seen him smoking a blunt outside in a public space on the sidewalk. Seriously, do they care about their clients or more about making money. When my husband complained to the bouncer about not letting his friend in, the bouncer would not let him back in. Not impressed with Playland's ability to treat everyone with respect and possibly discriminating. We left after a half hour of crappy service and did not let them ruin my birthday.
author: Karen B.

description:
In my opinion, Playland is one of the better establishments on Polk St. I came around 11:30 on a Friday night and there was a short line, but it moved fast. It was free for girls and $10 cover for guys. At a first glance, I thought it was the smallest bar ever but then noticed there was another room off to the side and also an upstairs area. There was a line to go upstairs and I understand why - it was PACKED. We managed to order a few drinks at the bar but the dance floor was full so we ended up going back downstairs. The music was good though. I ended up in the smaller room off the side where theres a good amount of seating and a small bar. S/o to the female bartender (forgot her name) that was there at the time, you were super fun! Drinks are regularly priced as expected ($9 shots, etc.).

I like how there's a few different areas that you can hangout in, and you can move from room to room. The only downside is the line to go upstairs and the bathrooms are inconveniently located. I did notice there was someone constantly cleaning the bathrooms though so at least they're being maintained. Overall, I had a great time here and will be back the next time I decide to go to Polk.
author: Cecille W.

description: Super fun place to grab a drink and dance with friends upstairs or chill and chat downstairs! Great selection of drinks, and the place has a really great ambiance.
author: Julia E.

description:
***Warning***


A group us of came to party, were having a great time, then were suddenly kicked out due to hat dress code at 1:00 am?

So you mean to tell me that not only did the doorman /  ID security forget to state the dress code at the door, but we also were enjoying the night for 3 hours (10 pm - 1 am) before they decide enforcing a new dress code rule during the last hour?!

There is nothing wrong with dress code enforced clubs / venues but it should be properly stated at the entrance, not after 3 hours of collecting our $$$ 

Had we known they can make up rules at the drop of a dime we would have chosen a  different venue.
author: Michael J. M.

description:
I love Polk Street - always a good night to be had. Unless you end up at Playland.  Then you can expect really crappy and overpriced drinks, a crowded and unsafe second floor, generic shuffled music (Spotify on random would do better), and generally awful experiences.

And, believe it or not, they even charged a cover!  That's the only reason we stayed more than 10 minutes - sunk cost fallacy.  

Word of advice - don't bother with any drink more advanced than Redbull Vodka or Rum & Coke.
author: Greg B.

description: I love monday nights at playland! They have happy hour all night, board games and Julia makes the best cocktails! My favourite one is Mezcalino. Highly recommend this spot especially if your Monday is your "friday" just like mine:)
author: Jesus M.

description:
I'm very aware playland doesn't give a fuck about the reviews for this place because they're still going to make money regardless of any circumstance. I just wanted to tell other people about my experience just in case they wanted go to this particular bar/club. 

I got there around 1215 and wanted to go inside to meet up with my friends. So my choice of ID to use when I go out is my passport because it's easier to use and harder to lose. I've been to this bar a couple times in the past so i know it works. I do look way different from my passport picture because I've become a makeup artist 3 years prior since acquiring my passport. 

To tie it back around, the bald bouncer that's out in the front wouldn't let me in because I don't look like my passport picture. Im pretty upset because he wouldn't let me try to prove otherwise since it was "to their discretion." I get he was trying to do his job but the thing that really pissed me off was him saying they would let me keep my passport only because it's a legal document. I wish the fuck he would have because then Id have a reason to sue him and the club for his ridiculousness. 

That aside, I do recognize that he is a person just trying to do his job. And no matter how upset I am about the whole ordeal, he is still human and humans make mistakes.
author: Alyssa P.

description: This is the second time I go to this establishment and I get profiled. This time I went with some friends. So the bouncer said, and this is before even conducting a search or even checking, but he assumed me and my friends were "sagging" and since we were on camera "sagging" we are not entitled to have access to the club. Mind you, I made sure I had on fitted pants and my friends also had pants that fit. We had belts and they just denied us entry. I seen earlier another person sagging and they went into the club no problem. I feel like this is either a racial thing since it's only been me and my friends that cannot get in or they are prejudice for how we look. They said I cannot speak to a supervisor and threatened to call police for not allowing us to get a justifiable answer. This is a poor excuse for an establishment that is meant to be fun and so called inviting. Complete cowards and frauds
author: Giovanni C.

description: Absolutely love this place for its specialty cocktails and excellent dance floor. This is my go to bar on polk st. when I want to get down and boogie to THE most current tracks out there.Shout out to bartender Judith for her attentive service and positive vibes throughout the entire night. The right staff really makes a business thrive and reach it's potential, so props to you.
author: Raj P.

description:
Just had a very unpleasant experience at this bar with Judith, the bartender upstairs. We had our first round of drinks and she was totally fine. Upon our second round of drinks I felt the apprehension and rude remarks from her. We had originally ordered 3 shots of Rye and 3 Shocktop Beers. But we had changed our minds to 3 shots of Rye and 2 Shocktops instead. We thought she heard us because we saw her pour only 2 cups of beers from the draft, but note there was 1 cup set aside from her previous pour (we did not know how long it has been sitting there). Upon serving us our drinks she served us 3 shots and 3 beers. We kindly informed her that we thought she acknowledged the fact that she heard us change the order to 2 beers as she only poured 2 cups. She responded with, "I can't even hear in here facing you guys you think I can hear you with my back turned to you? I mean I can't drink this beer because I'm working so I'll just have to throw it away?" *So take note, the other cup was from her previous pour for another customer that was left behind the bar.* Her response was just uncalled for. We ended up just taking the cup of beer, a small plastic Bud Light cup .


Finally the ticking point was her just being flat out rude to her next guests that were next to me. Judith claimed that her guest (who happened to be a tourist from another country) gave her a fake $100 bill. I saw the $100 bill with the yellow strike from her detection pen, and as someone who had worked in a bank, I know for sure what a real and a fake $100 bill looks like. After their altercation, I thought to have a conversation with Judith and inform her that a fake $100 bill would show a black color after using a detection pen. Judith had informed me that their bar received 8 different $100 bills last week that all showed a brighter yellow strike using the detection pen and all were fake. I responded by letting her know that there are other features on a $100 bill to determine whether or not it is so indeed counterfeit. I honestly was not trying to cause any trouble or call Judith out on any misconduct, (granted the fact that she should have confiscated the $100 bill that she analyzed as counterfeit per proper protocol), I was simply trying to provide assistance and knowledge. Judith coldly and harshly responded, "Oh yeah? In that case you want to come work here?" 

After hearing Judith's response to the situation, it was time for me to close out my bill and leave. I too am in the Beverage and Food business, having managed 3 highly rated establishments in the Bay Area, (Mortar & Pestle, Pink Elephant, AC Waterfront Lounge). I was appalled by Judith's lack of professionalism and idiotic sarcasm. After this experience, I definitely will not return. And as one last piece of advice, per ABC standard, follow your bar dress code and wear some non-slip shoes. You might fall and slip at your bar with your Vans. 

Happy Easter!
author: Kenneth K.

description: Wow.. its 12:19am on a Tuesday night. I came here to celebrate my coworkers going away. I ordered two coronas for my flself and my boss but your bartender said "your friend is cut off therefore you are as well" without any explanation...so hold on here...this was my 2nd drink of the night..I am not sure how my friend was cut off but cutting me off as well? Whoever was working on wed 22nd at 12:24am please have an explanation...bartender def ruined the night
author: Vic R.

description:
I had a fun time here. I came here on NYE super early to avoid cover, which was so funny cause we thought it would be empty inside. And it was!!! for like 10 minutes. I was glad cause we were one of the first people let upstairs so my group kind of took over one area, so it was never crowded for us haha. The music was definitely good. I LOVE bars where I can dance, and this one did not disappoint. I remember being handed an amf by my friend but tbh i have no recollection of how it tasted, or if i even ended up drinking it, so I'm not gonna be able to talk about the drink tastes and prices hahah. 

We ended up leaving when it got really crowded, which made me really happy cause there were way too many sweaty and handsy people. Be careful bringing valuables cause people were dropping drinks left and right! My suede heels got really messed up but that was totally my fault for wearing them out sigh )': 

The reason for the -1 star: the bathrooms!!!!!!! omg wth literally worst location to have a bathroom. I get the reason for only having one, its tiny af inside, but seriously try to change the bathroom location if possible. It adds unnecessary traffic and stress inside.
author: Malvika T.

description: Taylor at Playland bar makes the best mojitos and drinks! It's quick service and tastes awesome! Great atmosphere too!
author: Megan B.

description: Wish I can give it a 0 Star....If your looking into getting bottle service here dont waste your money. My bf got bottle service this weekend and we were enjoying our night, until the owner of the bar decided to come into our VIP area with his friend and girls, keep in mind we had paid for the VIP. He was very disrespectful, rude and unprofessional. We have gotten VIP in a lot of places and I have never experienced something like this. Also the bathrooms are sooo dirty.
author: Jesly M.

description: Barbora ROCKS !!! Love the music here best way to speand your holiday with the amazing friends and drinks
author: Ariel K.

description: Barbora make the best drink recommendation ever! She's the best bartender! Love her! She knows what drink you like! Like magic~
author: Lydia T.

description: The guys at the door are always rude, but tonight, they were beyond that point. A huge group of people literally walked away after they (bouncers) treated all the PAYING CUSTOMERS like crap. I won't be returning, unfortunately. Gotta do better guys :( .
author: Deondre J.

description: Cool bar cool waitress and cool Patriots we had such a great time here not to mention they have three different rooms and upstairs becomes a nightclub and they play the best music we had such a good time because the drinks are very strong and it's free before 10:00pm so if you can get in the bar before 10:00pm after that you do have to pay to get in and it gets real packed they also have a VIP section upstairs that they blocked off if you got the money to pay for
author: Mona L.

description: Playland is a total sweatbox, dance floor mania. If you are looking to get down and dirty, and dance the night away on a cramped dance floor, Playland is your place. It is a pretty typical SF bar, pretty small quarters, with the bar downstairs, and the dance floor upstairs with an additional two bars. The drinks are a bit pricey. If you come here on a weekend there is a 10 dollar cover for guys, and there is really no place to sit down. Playland can be really fun, it just depends what type of night you are looking for
author: Ross S.

description: Definitely a place for young people seeking dancing! Upstairs,Playland has a dance floor with a club-like ambience with lights, booths and a DJ. Downstairs, there's seating by the bar and a few tables in the back for a more intimate setting. Decent drink menu and bartenders are flexible with drink orders. $5 cover fee for guys. Great area to bar-hop with tons of people out and about!
author: Tori Y.

description: Racist Racist Racist!!!! From the shady owner watching from a camera down to the so called security who think they are in the secret service. Just because someone pulls there pants up who happens to be African American walking across the street means he he is sagging. First of all his pant were fitted and he just so happened to adjust as he was walking he poised a threat to the establishment. Funny enough as we were denied a Hispanic male and his friends came up looking to have a good time and he was denied because his pant were to baggy which there weren't and in his own words (Man I'm just a big guy). Pretty comical also how he tried to charge him out of the blue to enter when other people walked right in with no issue or charge. Happy I'm didn't spend a dime in this place and will definitely warn anyone I know not to step foot in this Racists Venue!
author: Dom D.

description: This place is lame. Door guy spent 5 full minutes going through my friend's bag. Then, I paid 14 bucks for a Manhattan in a plastic cup with a crack in it and a giant ice cube.  This place has no soul.  Notice most of the positive reviews for this place are from people not from SF.
author: Jk V.

description: Playland bar is a great place to go!!! Awesome place to watch sports, big TVs and great customer service. The bartenders are very friendly and helpful when it comes to drinks.
author: Hayden R.

description:
If you want to dance, this spot is great. The upstairs has a fun hip-hop/pop music vibe while a more traditional bar is downstairs. We got there a bit early on a Saturday but by 10:30 the place was starting to fill up. 

Dress code gets enforced after 10:00 pm (no shorts guys). This place is popular so don't show up too late or you can expect a long line.
author: Alex S.

description:
One word: Catherine. 

Beautiful, tends bar masterfully, and will make you feel less lonely. At least until you leave. 

Was here during the day, mid-week, so it was quiet. 

Will be back to see what the nightlife is like.
author: Khoa N.

description:
Was here after all the hype.. I'm pretty impressed! Bars with 2 floors with dance floor on the 2nd level! Dj's pretty dope with all the best new mixes! 

Trust me guys ull love it here if u have a large group just get u single ass here! ull def never walk alone
author: P K.

description: Playland bar is awesome. JUDITH the bartender rocks. She makes the greatest cocktails ever. OMG I love this place! Latin music dance party on Sunday night!
author: Mike M.

description:
Great service and excellent drinks! Ali knows how to make the Persian gimlet like no other! Can't wait to have a few more of those! 
For a monday night there was a Nice flow of customers in and out; a few regulars and some just visiting. TVs keep you entertained but the music is also a fun mix! Would come back for sure!
author: Ana F.

description: The drinks are solid for a place that specializes mostly in just getting people laid.
author: Doc C.

description: Did not let me in because. According to a bouncer, I was wearing sweatpants. I was not. I wear those to sleep, why the f*** would I wear that to go out
author: Clever P.

description: My first time here at Playland and I am greeted by Brenda! Her first night here and she was awesome! Shes so beautiful  See you again soon!
author: Ercan V.

description: My husband and I were recommended this place by a few locals for a place to dance. We arrived early in the evening around 9:30 on Friday so it wasn't busy yet. The bouncer was awesome and gave us some great info when he heard it was our first time there. Around 10:00 the DJ started playing and around 11:00 it started getting packed. The music was good; mainly what is on the radio right now. The crowd was dancing and singing and everyone was laid back. There was people dressed up and people dressed casual which was nice. Around 11:30 it was chaos. The whole upstairs was jam packed and it got really hard to move, let alone actually dance. The music was good though and the DJ played the music videos on multiple screens throughout the upstairs. This place is definitely great if you want to dance all night long! We are happy we found this place and will be back!
author: Jessica C.

description: Went there for a private event the other day (Warriors Watch Party). Drinks were great, the bartender made an awesome Dark & Stormy. She was doing awesome managing the upstairs bar by herself (she was attentive, remembered my name for the tab, etc). Definitely going back!
author: Chris H.

description: Came here during the St. Patrick's day bar crawl and it was a lot of fun. The mystery shots were surprisingly really good and the upstairs dance floor was poppin later at night.
author: Alka M.

description: Ali is the best bartender I've met! He definitely took care of us at Playland! Would recommend this place any day of the week!
author: Annamarie O.

description: I've been coming here for quite some time now and although it does have its faults just like any other business establishment, it really makes up for it in that it creates a diverse environment for just about anybody to enjoy. The bar downstairs has a backroom where you can get away from the loud noises in the front and also has its own small bar. The bar upstairs turns into a dance lounge and they have different events on certain days of the week. The place does get crowded on the weekends, but normally during the week it's very chill and a great place to meetup for drinks with coworkers.
author: Brian P.

description:
I was visiting SF for a weekend and decided to check this place out with some friends. A couple of us had been here before and they liked it, I had not so I was down to go in and have some drinks. However, the bouncer didn't even let us in - he took about 5 mins looking at my Washington driver's license before declaring it fake and confiscating it. This was ridiculous, I've never been accused of using a fake ID before, let alone ever even needing one. Also, was he even allowed to just confiscate it like that? I had to argue with him just so I can get my driver's license back, but was still not allowed in. We finally gave up and just went a block up the street to another bar.

Reading the recent reviews here, I'm pretty disappointed this happened. It's sad that a bouncer isn't able to tell fake IDs from real ones, this guy must either be new or maybe I'm just unlucky. 2 of us with non-California licenses got bounced. Although, one of our other (non-Asian) friends was allowed in just a few moments later, despite also having a Washington license. Regardless of why this happened, I will not be coming back the next time I visit SF. Thank god there's plenty of other choices on Polk St!
author: Josh L.

description:
Don't let the three stars fool you. This MIGHT be a four even five star review if we came at a different time. We came on a Saturday night and was unbelievably packed! To the point where it was nothing but pushing and shoving at the dance floor. The music was decent, not really my cup of tea, but definitely had some good moments. More of a top 40 and popular "hip hop" sounds. 

The bouncers are actually very on top of things. We saw them approach and address multiple people at times that it was needed. 

Would definitely come back at a time where it's not so crowded to hang out. The drinks were good and of course pricey just like everywhere else in this town.
author: Eddie H.

description: Awesome place for a spontaneous night :) super friendly and welcoming bartenders !! :) Barbora was especially wonderful! Will definitely come back when back in town!
author: Dorothy Y.

description:
I will never go to this place again which sucks because the dancing aspect here is actually really good. 

Ok first off, you literally have to push people out of your way to walk anywhere! Its absurd. 

Second, not sure if it was just the bar upstairs but my friends ordered 2 separate drinks, and they tasted like sewer water. (not even exaggerating) it was absolutely disgusting. 

I preferred the bar area on the bottom floor, hidden in the back from the first bar when you walk in. 

Also, when going to the bathroom, me and my friends almost got sexually assaulted as a man tried to enter the single bathroom, and I had to literally push him out the door to prevent him from either trying to rape us in the bathroom, or something else. 

and although there were security there, there was definitely not enough for the amount of people in there. 

Guys were really disgusting there. 

And sloppy people everywhere. 

Regardless, whatever drink the bartender made it had something quite nasty in it.

and zero stars for everything mentioned above.
author: Janessa H.

description: I went to playland bar the first time with my friend. The staff was AMAZING, our bartender Cat was fantastic. She was so friendly and personable not to mention her drinks were delicious! The vibe was hella cool. Definitely will come back!
author: Victoria C.

description:
Came here during SantaCon festivities, so I'll refrain from reviewing cover charge/security/overall vibe because it was a special event. 
First, the good: cheap drinks and an awesome view of Polk St from the upper level. We hung out by the windows because it got hotter than Africa in the main bar area, and it was super fun looking down at all the Santas parading (euphemism for "stumbling") below. The bartenders here do a great job noticing everyone at the bar and serving drinks quickly even with a huge crowd! It was also a fun crowd, which could be due to SantaCon, but not as dicey as some spots on Polk where you're clutching your purse under your arm the whole time and waiting for the next fight to break out. 
The floorplan of this joint makes zero sense. There is one (1) (uno) restroom for every sardine packed in here, located on the first floor in a little hallway next to the stairs. This means that the massive line will inevitably block traffic to the stairs and the rest of the downstairs area. I felt so bad for the security guard who had to consistently usher crowds away from the line. The stairs also made me super nervous, because they were so congested and were legitimately shaking from the amount of people packed onto them. Security tries to control the flow of traffic, but people posted up on the stairs and started partying there, which isn't cool for everyone trying to get through
author: Delaynie K.

description:
Legit. Bouncers were on top of anything stupid happening, the DJ was really good and the wait at the bar was super short. 

Definitely recommend, and it's a pretty cool place to just watch a game if you go early
author: Aaron S.

description:
$20 minimum for credit cards.
About $13 a shot for Hennessy and they give you very little chase
Downstairs is more relaxed than the upstairs. 
Can get pretty packed.
No cover fees when I went -- might have been a little after 10p.
author: Amy V.

description: The dance floor was crowded on Sunday Latin night, but I prefer that over an empty one. Oh most importantly it's too bad they have a rude bouncer (photo included) he came over to my group of 5 and said we were being too loud threatening to kick us out. I admit my cousins and I have high pitched laughs, but we don't fight, we buy many drinks,and when we were dancing it was with everyone. I say get rid of that bouncer!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Crowded and just a bunch of drunk kids that haven't ever gone to a bar before. Skip and somewhere else. Soda papinskis is just up the road.
author: Alex L.

description:
What a strange club. I don't know if it was a special night but holy moly. Packed like sardines. No windows or ventilation. So the sweat just condensated. Made the floors slippery. It was 98% guys. Nothing wrong with that I just thought it was really weird. Most were just standing around. Hard to dance because there were wayyy too  many people. I had to get out because I couldn't breathe. 

I definitely did not like that. Maybe I'll catch it on a better night but this place is super hyped up. It's kinda cool they play the music videos on the TV screens. I guess I also wasn't having it because I was very sober.
author: Lynn C.

description: Came to celebrate my boyfriend's 27th birthday a few weeks ago and had a GREAT time! Mae sure to come early because this place can fill up quick, especially the upstairs. One of the reasons why we had such a great time was because of one of the bartenders upstairs- Judith. She was super friendly and super quick with our drinks & always remembered what we ordered each time we went back. She had such a positive attitude, in spite of being super busy. We would definitely come back! Thank you Judith!!
author: H. L.

description: The bartender B is the greatest. So sweet and so attentive!! I absolutely enjoyed my time here because of her
author: Jen T.

description:
Ran into this bar while wandering (bar hopping) my way through the city. The space itself was small and lucky for us there was a free table near the entrance. We sat and I immediately saw the cucumber basil gimlet on their extremely large scroll like menu on the wall. So two cucumber gimlets. 

I eagerly approached the bar and made eye contact with the female bartender who was holding a conversation at the end of the bar, after waiting what seemed like an eternity, she finally strolled over and asked what I was having and asked for my ID as well as my companions' who was seated at the table. A bit reluctant because of the ultra slow and sort of rude service, we handed over our IDs and soon enough received our drinks.

$10 a piece for the most syrupy, non alcoholic suppose to have alcohol beverage I've had that didn't come from a night club. Highly disappointing. Should have left when we had the chance.
author: Genoa D.

description: I came on Sunday , salsa night the music was great but towards 1130 pm the club was packed and there was no room to dance, like people where about to fight each other because everyone was knocking into each other. But the dj had a great variety of Latin hits , salsa, cumbia, merengue, reggaeton, and tribal.
author: Monie M.

description:
My girls from Memphis were in town and staying right down the street from Playland so we all decided to give it a shot last night. I'm GLAD we did and I definitely will be back! The line to get in was longer than you would anticipate anywhere on a Thursday night in SF, but thankfully we were able to get in quickly. (Memphis girls aren't used to the lovely weather we have here in SF.) Drinks were reasonably priced, and considering how many people were there the quick service from the bartenders upstairs was appreciated. The music selection by the DJ was great! A good mixture of genres that kept everyone moving. 

After 11, the dance floor upstairs was packed. Like, sardines packed. I went outside for some fresh air and noticed that some crazy young girl was literally ALL up in the door guy's face demanding that he give her ID back. Intrigued, I sit back and watch the show. Not even two minutes later, this girl's MOTHER is at her side cussing and threatening the guy for her daughter's ID. To my (and everyone who was watching with me) surprise, he was brushing them off with more patience than we all expected. When they were done with him, they went straight to the manager who was waiting for them a few feet away. Ding Ding, let round two begin! Mom and daughter are now tag-teaming the manager. I'm thinking, "This is it! This crazy, rude, and obnoxious mom and daughter duo are about to get it, and my girls are upstairs missing it!" Wrong. He acknowledges their anger and frustration but somehow manages to stay calm and patient throughout their entire exchange. Finally realizing that they weren't getting a rise out of him or the ID back, they both walked away, defeated. Hat's off to both of those guys for remaining professional and courteous, when they really didn't have to considering how insanely rude that mom and daughter were to them. 

My only complaint is that if you go downstairs to use the restroom (which are all located on the ground floor) or outside for some air, you will have to wait in line a few minutes to get back upstairs to the dance floor.
author: Jessica M.

description: downstairs was slow...went upstairs and the music was great. Stephanie was my bartender for the night -she's great!
author: Baldeep K.

description: Always a great time at Playland Bar.. bar in the front, lounge in the back, and a dance floor upstairs; there's something for everyone!
author: Mo S.

description: Decent bar. If u come on weekdays there's only one bartender hooking up her friends so that's annoying. Fruit flies galore. Weekends the lines can get long.
author: Nick Y.

description: This is the best bar in SF with the best cocktails and prices. Gotta see Cat, she's the best! Weekends are fun here with DJs and dancing, but if you want a relaxing experience, come during the week. Try a Caribbean Treasure, it has diplomatic rum and egg white foam... so good!
author: Tokunbo E.

description:
BEWARE: It gets really stuffy and crowded upstairs. You will be sweating and rubbing up against people when trying to make your way to the bar.

We couldn't stand to wait in the long line for Halloween this year, so my friend ended up getting two tables. Each table was $500 and came with 5 comps. The rest of our party got to skip the line, but had to pay cover ($10 for girls, $20 for guys). The main stage tables are the best because they rope them off, but they were taken. The staff ended up just pushing two bar tables together in the corner for us. It was pretty ghetto. 

Still, it ended up being okay because 1) we were in the corner with the glass windows so we stayed relatively cool, uncrowded, and got to people watch all the Halloween shenanigans going on downstairs on Polk street, and 2) we were very drunk.

This is a solid spot because it's usually always packed, and they play all the hip hop faves, none of that EDM bullshit. Check it out, and if you can manage to grab a table, even better!
author: Claudia W.

description:
I've been here a few times, well I've crawled here from Diva's after a buncha drinks blah ha.
AManda rocks used too do karaoke here now she passed it on over to stella.

Maybe it should be called wild Stella karaoke now.

Karaoke here is every tuesday.

The beer prices aren't bad.
They have a groupon for a pub crawl that sometimes includes this place.

THis place is very roomy so you can bust some moves without bumping into people.

The ambiance is real nice.
It gets pretty wild here with the crowd that's fer sure.

Its pretty easy to get the crowd going , that's fer sure.

There's some pretty good doughnut places around here too.
author: Luke S.

description: Came in on a Monday. Slowish, but ended up just shooting it with the bartender: Jessica. She was really funny/friendly, we talked craft cocktails and hockey (Go Preds). She made me a great Paper Plane cocktail off their menu and also told me about their Sunday Latin nights. I'll be back, check it out and have a good time.
author: Nick C.

description: Worst experience at a sf bar, came here on a SLOW  Saturday night, got stereotyped after the fact I was in the bar PAYING for a drink.  The so called manager asked his so called security to come over to the bar where I was signed to tell me I was not welcomed while his Caesar's self walked by listening.  Without an explanation of why I can't sit here and enjoy the music and a drink I get told I have to leave.  The manager and the bouncers are racist stereotypical cowards and now I understand the reason why this place has so many bad ratings. Being an sf native there are many better places to go to the owner/manager should read threw the yelp reviews once in awhile to improve on the service.
author: Ada M.

description: This is a fun bar but always packed. Dance floor upstairs that's always full. Cover on most weekend nights. If you come around midnight the wait will be long.
author: SeungJin K.

description:
Playland has a great upstairs and dance floor, however it can get super crowded and busy during the weekends. As a female I don't have to pay a cover charge, however my guy friends usually do. 
Drinks are good, great music, all and all a good time out with friends.
author: Ronni M.

description:
My first impression was not good: Gender based cover charge, even though I was with 3 women. This is San Francisco, we're supposed to be above gender discrimination.
The bouncers were doing an okay job considering how insanely packed the place was, but it was borderline unsafe upstairs. My friend got stomped on multiple times by large men (she's short), even I'd get thrown around and I'm not small.

There's also two toilets for all genders at the entire establishment. Conveniently placed on the tiny hallway between the two parts of the bar. Unsurprisingly this ends up with a line blocking the whole place.
author: Kurt N.

description: I enjoy happy hour at Playland. Only $4 for a pint! And always a good convo with my bartender Julia
author: ziad a.

description:
I was touched inappropriately by several guys in one night. I reported it to the management and they said, "we have no control of the men that we let in here". 
I will never return here again. No woman should be treated like this.
author: Madison C.

description: LOVE this place!!! Downstairs it's a bar with cocktails places to sit down and upstairs it's a dance floor with good dancing music! Every time I go there I have a blast and every friend I take there becomes a client :) the only thing that could be improved is the fact that they don't have a coat check! ‍
author: Renata F.

description:
Lost my credit card and promised to call back in the morning - did not do that, had to wait 30 minutes on a Saturday night before they could tell me that they lost my credit card. 

Charged cover even though the door policy says that they don't charge until 10:30 pm.
author: David W.

description: Too hard to chat with your friends upstairs, although the DJ was good on a Friday night. The crowd is for 20-somethings with mid-drifts and short shorts. The vibe is a bit pretentious and the dance floor was too small. Only came here to meet my friends before ditching this place for McTeagues.
author: Moua L.

description: Fun place, especially when you're single. Always lots of beautiful people. Still a little bitter that they confiscated my flask and then I lost it forever... Loud, recent music. Fun on the weekends, even Sunday nights. I went on a Sunday when they had Latino music night, not sure if that's every week, but it was a blast.
author: Jackie L.

description: I have been going to Playland every Friday,Yesterday I was there with my friends who were visiting from Turkey and someone stole my friends phone. We asked for help to find it and the only thing the employees told us was" this happens every time , we can't find your phone " I was really disappointed. We asked them to open the cameras bc we knew the exactly time when the phone was stolen and they start yelling at us and saying you have to get put of here. I'm never going back to a place when nothing is safe
author: Kristina S.

description: This was my first time here at Playland, intriguing conversation with Julia and awesome drinks!
author: Caitlin R.

description: I love Playland on Wednesday night! If you are looking for a cozy place with a delicious cocktails and a nice company of a smily bartender, Playland is a great place to spend your time. My favorite cocktail is Playland Mule! It is basically a Moscow Mule, but I think they have a special recipe for this drink. If you are here, Moscow Mule is a Must Try. I had an amazing experience and highly recommend this place!
author: Alena H.

description: Went to Playland on Wednesday night! Loved the atmosphere there! I tried all the specials, my favorite is cucumber gimlet! Tastes like summer, very refreshing. The bartender's name was Lana if I remembered it right, she is a very lovely girl! If you are in the area, definitely go to Playland!
author: Ksenya U.

description: Bartender is so welcoming and nice. He does some great tasting unique cocktails. Awesome chill spot.
author: Gloribel T.

description: Best bartender was Ariel, beyond accommodating and understanding. Management should be grateful that they have people like Ariel on staff!!
author: Daniel K.

description:
It's been a while since I've gone out dancing. Imagine my surprise when we did an impromptu stop by Playland. It was Friday, May 1st around 12:30pm.

I used to love going out just to dance in my 20s. Now in my 30s, I still like dancing, but I hate dealing with the crowds. At Playland, I honestly didn't mind since I was having so much fun!

I don't believe we drank at all while we were here. We just hung out upstairs and danced the night away. The music was perfect as it was mostly top 40. Easy to dance to as I loved top 40 and hip hop back in the day.

It was fun reliving my 20s just a little. I do love dancing and Playland let me indulge in that. Out of the couple of stops we made along Polk, this was my favorite.
author: Elena N.

description: Was in town visiting and all of the bars were cool until I got to this one. They are very rude in the upstairs portion especially the blonde bartender. You can't even call the bar to check if your tab was left open there. They redirect you to some "corporate" office. When I did make it to the bar to get my Credit Card finally, come to find out the bartender must have been putting everybody's drinks on my tab. They charged my for a big tab and all I had was 2 Coronas. Two thumbs down on this place
author: Keilan W.

description:
Walking along the lit up thoroughfare of the Polk Street nightlife, my friends and I were encouraged by the rumbling of fellow bar-goers that stumbled about. There are many good bars in the area, but one I had yet to visit had my eye, Playland Bar. A line around the corner, modern architecture, and beautiful black slate sign, I felt like I might meet a good time inside.

After a 5-10 minute wait wait in line, I found myself face to face with a bouncer who assured me the $15 cover charge is worth it. We obliged out of semi-drunken curiosity, stamped ourselves in, and were ushered into a cool lower level bar where people mingled and met with arriving friends. I ventured around as my shoulders pressed back and forth between groups of people, and was quickly turned around as i unknowingly entered a private back room.

No matter, I wanted a drink, so I got one. Whiskey Sour ($12). As I waited for my drink, as did my friends, we found ourselves being pushed about by a drunken, self-entitled mess: "the bathroom line". Annoyed by the inadequate lack of space between different facets of the bar, I managed to get a drink in just a few minutes, and we headed toward the upper floor.

"Stop," A bouncer says to my friend. He asks my friend to remove his ball cap, as hats are apparently a form of gang symbol in the area. My friend was forced to hold his ball cap beside him the whole night.

We trudged upstairs in a flurry of people and came face to face with a medium-size dance floor style area with two small bars. We took toward the floor in a slow plod. Like air in a rubber balloon, as people began to enter though the middle of the dance floor, subsequent patrons were pushed outward. The sweat began to condense over the windows, flying elbows made drinks bob up and down like buoys in an ocean storm. When I came to a point of no further advancement, the dance floor seemed just out of reach, unattainable.

We decided to mingle elsewhere, and we found ourselves with a group of lovely young women who eyed us down with looks that seemingly spoke louder than words. Words have little effect here as the music on the upper level blares above most conversational volume; all the more reason to dance to keep things from getting awkward. After we shared some of our drinks with them, they began to advance on us in a way that ousted a knee-jerk reaction from my friend:  "I'll buy shots!"

He paid an ungodly amount of money for five or six shots, and the women quickly faded into the sweaty abyss of Playland like Jack Dawson into the Atlantic. With hope of finding our way back to the dance floor, we sought out the other upper level bar for more liquid encouragement, and hopefully some conversation. 

I bought another Whiskey Sour, because, well, it was a damn good drink. However, this time it cost me $15, which I tried to fix with the bartender, a woman who had little bereavement for the mistake. My friend was given the wrong amount of change as well, so it gave me the impression of someone capitalizing on drunken customers. (An impression, nothing more.) However, based on the quality of the second Whiskey Sour (piss poor), I'm convinced there was either some neglect by the staff, or they were testing out a new trainee.

After speaking to some beautiful older women out on a bachelorette party, it took us till nearly 12:30-1PM until we could manage enough room for adequate dancing.  Before that, dancers are subject to the sweltering heat of the looming sweat-fog and the jabbing of butt shoves from men with confusingly hostile temperaments.

We left the bar in an Uber with little desire to return. Sweat rendered our shirts wet, and our satisfaction on the night was at a minimum, especially relative the lack of money in our pockets.
author: Shane M.

description: Worst place ever. -1000 stars. Don't ever open a tab and go use the restroom. They will actually force you to wait in line to go close your tab. Awful.
author: Michael O.

description:
Good day to everyone and hope San Francisco has treated you with love or will treat you with love when you do get here, Hehehe

Not sure if I should say my name or what but what the heck, I'm Keiki and everyone knows me as ThePandaPhotographer from 646Studios.com and I'd travel most of my time as a photographer and when I am in a city, I like to take risk in a small way. That risk is just looking for a place for a good drink but I am very selective in that category but I wasn't planning to go out on a Wednesday night but yesterday evening, I've met one Canadian named Amanda and one Australian at the downtown hostel and we just click and decided to go bar hopping. So we just went around town looking for places and drink but there was one that stood out and we had to check Playland Bar out. I'd like the low light theme and as a photographer it was well lit. Now about Christian the bartender Wednesday night (last night). What an amazing guy and what he was doing at the bar was extremely cool with the hand skills and tricks but not only that, he made some nice and beautiful drinks. I'd like an IPA beer and my IPA was good and not flat like the last place we visit before Playland but my new hostel friends wanted mix drinks this time around. I had a very interested and fun time at playland. We were all upstair and didn't get a chance to visit the downstairs level to check it out. The lighting was excellent and I would love to take some photos of the place and that was the plan in a way from the next day but I can't, maybe next time. The space is good for groups or for a date if you are on one. There are two restrooms on the first level but I am not sure for the lower level but I'd have confident in Playland to have two more. This will be mine place to just hangout with I am not doing work and will just have a drink or two. I'm not a party person that much and just like to keep things smooth and relax. Maybe this is the place for you and maybe it's not and I am not   doing this for the place at all but doing this to share an experience with you and maybe you will decided on your own if this place is good or not. As I said before, it may not or maybe the place you are looking for. So the total time we were there was about 25-45 minutes talking and drinking and feeling good. So it was a very pleasant experiences  and hope you have one of the same.

Enjoy
author: Keiki-Alexander D.

description: The door guys are hella extra. They swear it's Vegas or something. They didn't let us in because of baggy pants? Umm baggy is big ass pants that look 5 sizes big. I'm like 35 years old so no I don't own pair of baggy pants and sure as hell ain't wearing skinny jeans. Don't spend your money there just go to the other bars in the area. They will treat you a lot nicer. If I can give zero stars I would. To the douche bouncers treat everyone equal not just girls with big boobs and butts. You're probably not going to get none anyways!
author: Lex J.

description:
Great service and a nice atmosphere.

A couple friends and I went to Playland on Wednesday night. We loved the bar and the atmosphere. It was a slow night but it was still fun. Our server (I think her name was Lana) was very nice and energetic, which made up for the slow night. We were only visiting on business but I will definitely be coming back to this bar next time I stay in SF.
author: Seth B.

description:
This place was cool except for the fact that some asshole grabbed a nice handful of (my) ass as I was ordering a drink at the bar. RUDE. It was so damn packed I couldn't identify him (or her??? lol jk it was def a guy) among the masses of people passing by. 

Anyway other than that, it's pretty poppin up in hurr. I got over it pretty quickly because I was already pretty drunk and my friend handed me a shot of jamie right after. So I was ok lol. But next time.... anonymous butt grabbers I will f*ck you up.

I like that they have 2 floors - downstairs to chill and the upstairs to get cURAZY! Ok maybe not but there are bars both upstairs and downstairs, as well as a dance floor upstairs. It gets crackin up there! lol

Dranks are cool. My friend bought me a "bye felicia" lololol and that was pretty good. But after that it was shot shot shots shoshotssthsktshtksetef so I can't recommend anymore lol.

It's also good to get yourself a stamp in case you wanna return sometime during the night. But also don't be too drunk so they'll actually let you back in LOL - my idiot friend can tell you all about that.

Anyway, cool spot! Watch out for ass grabbers!
author: Fran B.

description: Excellent service! Def get the paper plane drink. The whiskey selection is amazing with options from hibiki to Macllan.
author: Cuong T.

description: Santacon was the day when i first visited this bar and was surprised by the rude staff on duty. There was a young African-American security staff who was forcefully stopping by hand men and women alike instead of talking, when i complained that your staff cannot treat people like this and you cannot touch people to another senior staff member (Hispanic-Latino american), he just didn't take action on my complaint. It should be reported to police and this staff should be fired.
author: Adam U.

description: Good drinks, friendly staff, great happy hour and an awesome night life. What more could you ask for? There's lots of bars on Polk street but we always end up here. We like that you can get a drink and talk downstairs and dance upstairs.
author: Laura M.

description: I like to dance the floor upstairs and I can not just sit down and lost in my phone. Everything good,but when 2 a.m.,red necktie man keep yelling at us even I waiting for Uber .I'm not drunk at that time.So I kinda feel bad when the guy yelling at me to go away.At least,just say 'please' or gentle talking.Anyway,I still going for some weekend and just out before 1 a.m.
author: Gorngamon K.

description: Shit people come here. They'll steal your iPhone. Don't trust people.
author: Kelly G.

description:
A great bar in Nob Hill. I brought my friend here who was visiting from out of town for a drink. 

We loved the ambiance and friendliness of the bartenders when we came in to the place. We sat down at the bar, and the bartenders made some recommendations. 

We order the Ginger Patch and Strawberry Basil. Both were divine. They they suggested that I get the Diplomatic Exclusive, which was delish and intriguing, definitely a try! 

We came on a week night, and the place was just what we needed. I have stopped by on the weekend, and it is pack and hopping, totally different scene.

If you are looking for some great cocktails, infused with fresh fruit and herbs, during the week day,  say after work, this is the place to go! As for the weekend, if you are looking for happening, packed place with great drinks (but have to wait a bit for a drink), then I suggest this place too! 

Sip, sip, sip on fellow Yelpers:)
author: Sonia A.

description: Cat (the bartender) is amazing.  Drinks are awesome.. love my play land mule... love the ambiance...
author: Tu N.

description: This is the best bar I have ever been to! Barbora is the best bartender I've ever had. She knows her alcohol & comes up with the best drinks, she asks what what your favorite alcohol is and makes recommendations on what you'll like and does her best! We visited from LA & this experience up here has been amazing! If you want good drinks and good customer service, this place is the best! Tip her 25%! The experience is worth it!!
author: Nissa T.

description: I went to Playland on a Monday night with some co workers while we were in town and we had a lovely night. The upstairs bar was closed (since it was Monday, I am guessing) so I can't comment on that atmosphere or crowd. Morgan was our bartender and was super helpful when we were indecisive on what to order. We tried the Gin Cucumber Gimlet and it was right on. She was really attentive and chatted with us for a bit. We are in town often and hope Morgan is there on Monday nights!
author: Birdie C.

description:
Ladies are free anytime (or at least Friday and Saturday nights when I've gone).  
And ladies, if there's a long line to get in full of mostly gentleman, you walk right on up to the bouncer and in you go.  

The dance floor is upstairs with 2 or 3 bars, and it is always packed to the brim.  Like you can barely sway side to side sometimes, and it can get pretty annoying and frustrating actually with people constantly shoving their way through and spilling their drinks on you left and right (please try not to do that).  

Usually we squeeze our way towards the back and to the side, where you get some breathing and elbow room.  They play Top 40s and songs that everyone knows; it's always fun when you and everyone else can sing along and dance to :) There are also less creepers compared to other SF clubs, as most are in their 20s.  

If you're not into that scene then you can chill in the lounge downstairs, where there are 2 bars.  Dress code here ranges from dressy to casual-but-not-grungy-or-sloppy-yet-put-in-some-effort.  

Overall, always a fun time here and a great way to end the night!
author: Emmeline C.

description: I've been almost everywhere in SF and I definitely can tell - i got the worst experience in Playland! If you are looking for a good music - avoid that place (there is mostly old hip hop / rap), if you are looking for good sound - forget about that place (you can barely recognize a melody). The worst thing in there is security staff - without any reason they can kick you out from that place just cuz you were staying not in the right spot - a saw today how it happened at least 10 times - ppl were just dancing in front of a bar on (attention!) a dance floor and couldn't understand why, and after they tried to figure it out a security guy called another on an he send people out... Also don't expect any apologies from ppl who will be pushing you and stepping on your feet all night... In conclusion, I wish I could give that place something like  minus 100 stars, I would do it without any doubts. Avoid that place if you respect yourself.
author: Anton Y.

description:
Playland is an chill spot on polk your looking to boogie upstairs. Not gonna lie it crowded AF upstairs with bodies which makes it too hot. They have some AC but you better be under the damn thing always no point lol.

Downstairs on the cooler side if your trying to mingle, chill or have a few drinks. Not excited paying $20 when i bring females but hey no gender discrimination right. 

All in all security is cool and is fun place.
author: Azziz I.

description:
Better than average party spot on Polk, not dirty or ghetto & there's an option between turning it up in the upstairs lounge/club with a live video DJ, or staying on the quieter, smaller bar downstairs. It's equivalent to Raven Bar, except that place has hella asians and out of town people. Playland is less pretentious and "Azn."

Never had any issues getting drinks upstairs, the bouncers are respectful, and drinks aren't severely overpriced. Decent craft beer selection on tap if you're trying to get your IPA on.

Busy on Thursday nights through the weekend. On my most recent night, I think it was 80s night or something since I heard a ton of Michael Jackson, but that became hip hop and tiny bit of big room house throughout the night. Really depends on the DJ, that night it was Dj Chicken Scratch. Requests are pretty easy to put in if you so desire.

Chill.
author: Steven C.

description:
So, we went here the afternoon before the movies this past weekend and had a good time! We attended many hours ahead of our scheduled tickets for Iñárritu's "Birdman" film at the AMC, so there was still ample room for a smile here.

Plenty of room, in fact -- we were the first to get seats that afternoon. Glad we arrived when we did, though, as the space was filled in about ten minutes! A bulldog, Homer Simpson, Betty Boop, and other character designs were professionally nailed into the bar surface, under the glass. More smiles generated...

Onto the drinks! We enjoyed the following:
-Apricot Diplomat (w Rum)
-Lost in the Sauce (w Whiskey, smokey)
-Strawberry Basil Martini & Fine As Wine (very lavendery) for other half
-Gavroche for each

Most were cocktails, but the Gavroches were delectable beers. Bartender was sweet and knew her stuff. Noticed there was a second floor here, so I see this place can satisfy many!
author: Garett T.

description: My first time at Playland and I'm definitely a fan. It was a great spot to catch a basketball playoff the other day because it's not too packed and they play the volume on games so that you can actually hear the commentary (instead of loud music during games). Happy hour deals are great here, $3 draft beers (including 321, deschutes, shock top, Stella) 4-7pm. Bartender service was spot on. They don't serve food here, but you can bring food in. Our bartender noticed a lot of people asking for food, so he found a couple large bags of chips and peanuts and started sharing it with the bar which was cool. There's a large back room which apparently is for dancing in the evening hours and is also available to rent. Variety of cocktails available as well. Solid choice in the crowded Polk-gulch corridor.
author: Will H.

description: Place is a great time, latin music was great and staff is very friendly.  Would recommend for a Sunday Funday!
author: David D.

description:
Not the best looking place, but certainly has a personality. When my friends and I waltzed in early on a Friday night (9PM ish), we managed to get in for free. Downstairs was pretty populated but the upstairs area was nearly empty save for a few people floating by the bar or the couches along the wall. Typical dim lighting, sticky wooden floors, and an almost disused look to it. We took up camp on the stage at the back because there were couches available and we were fascinated by the R&B throwback music videos playing on the two TV screens. First impression? A random chill R&B lounge.

As the music transitioned into modern pop hits more people straggled in to join our awkward dancing. We were also kicked off the stage because it's apparently reserved for not-so-private parties, guarded by red ropes and bouncers. The bartenders were fun-loving and eager to dance while mixing our drinks, adding to the increasingly lively atmosphere. By about 11PM when the DJ phased into EDM, the top floor was essentially a dance club, with barely enough room for various staff to squeeze past the writhing bodies. Which they did REALLY often. 

Anyways, crowd is nice for the most part but prepare to stand your ground against a few aggressive dancers as usual.
author: Helen S.

description:
If it were possible to give this place 0 stars, then I so would. My roommate and I went to this place with a couple of friends thinking it would be a great night but the bouncer who was there was beyond rude and condescending. First of all, Vlad Ruben asked a bunch of unnecessary questions about our ID's, assuming they were fakes, and because one of my friends jokingly said "I'm drunk" when asked why he got his zip code wrong, he decided not to let any of us in. We have never been accused of using fakes especially because ours are actually real. He stated that having us in the bar would be a liability. 
When my roommate proceeded to defend our friend and try to reason with the bouncer, he repeatedly referred to her in demeaning pet names like "baby" and "sweetheart," even though she politely asked him to stop because her name was Olivia. Once she grew tired of it, she asked to please speak to the manager and he informed us that they had no manager on duty. 
All in all, even he recognized he was being unnecessarily disrespectful to all of us yet made no attempts to stop his abusive behavior. In a time when I was trying to feel good and be surrounded with good vibes considering all that has been going on with our country, this one person made us feel unsafe and disrespected and put an end to tonight's attempted festivities.
author: Melanie L.

description: Was here for a drink before it got crazy packed. Place turns into a club. Not really my scene but if that's what you like then this is the place for you.
author: Joseph B.

description:
The upstairs has a great area to dance in, with fun music and interesting music videos showing! 

However, we ordered shots at the downstairs bar and upon ordering we were quoted $11, and after drinking the blonde bartender told us "I accidentally gave you the discounted employee price, it's $16 each."
author: Pat C.

description: Came here on a Sunday to meet friends who were already inside. The first thing security asks me to do is to pull up my shirt. Which is weird I have never been asked that before. I pull up my shirt and he says I can't get in because I am sagging. Just because my pants weren't skin tight and were barely sitting below my waist they didn't let me in? I then proceed to slightly pull up my pants and tighten my belt. If I was intentionally sagging it would have been called out right away and they wouldn't have had to ask I felt profiled. The security guards told my friends who were inside that people have been getting there phones stolen so I guess they are profiling people in hopes of reducing this, because security said that is why they are being strict. If more than one person on yelp feels they have been profiled by this place it must be true. Then the security guard proceeds to tell me that the Manager is on duty and is watching the cameras and called me out and that if he wasn't there he would've let me in. In addition to this while I am pleading my case to go in I see a person come out of Playland sagging and with a hat on and soccer jersey and my friends who were inside later on tell me they saw people sagging and dressed way more casually than I was inside. Frustrating experience! Would not recommend unless you want to risk getting profiled and made to feel like you're some kind of thug.
author: Abraham G.

description:
There's about a trillion people here on a Friday night. But if you're patient in line, the bouncer will let you upstairs and it gets pretty ratchet fun. The crowd is generally young and the music is awesome. You really know all the songs b/c it's a mix of top 40s and 90s pop. 

You really end up dancing a storm with or without the influence of alcohol. From what I remember, everyone was super friendly and the drinks were ok priced (?). 

Finally girls get in free. Guys have a cover. But it's like $5 or 10
author: April Z.

description:
Great bar club with an upstairs and downstairs, but mostly upstairs for being able to dance!  

I like the name to this place!

It's a fun play place to be at and music is mainstream for the most part! 

I super like how girls don't have to pay a cover on a Friday night!

Fun, fun, fun and play, play, play!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Trying to get your groove on or are a post grad like me trying to go out like I did in college? Then this is the place.  

You have everything from no room, no AC, and the frat boys/frat boy wannabes there in their Hawaiian shirts...We all know that guy who goes to the club in those shirts in college. 

Not going to lie, I love that kind of vibe being in my young 20s just trying to have some fun.  If you love to dance and don't really care about your make up sweating off, then this is the place for you. NOTE: If you are dancing, skip the eye shadow. That thing is coming off when you dance here.

The dance floor is a small space that everyone crams into and there are only 2 fans located in the whole dance space, so if you are lucky to be dancing in it than a win for you.  If you aren't one of the lucky ones, then hopefully you are drunk enough to not even care.

Now, I ordered a Mai Tai for a friend and the bartender gave me a "What is a Mai Tai" look which is what happened with our drink.  It was definitely not a Mai Tai and my friend could not drink it.  Thankfully, there was a lot of alcohol in it for whatever it was. Not sure if Mai Tais are not a common thing, but I would just think they would say sorry we don't have that here instead.

Also, there is a $20 min for using your cards :(
author: Alisa S.

description: Playland is a cool spot with a great service. Delicious cocktails and fresh hiphop playlist!
author: Alex F.

description: Great music, drinks are always good. The only bad thing is it gets very crowded very fast and there isn't enough seating
author: Asante B.

description:
This is what make San Francisco the best!  
Great atmosphere 
good drinks about $7-$12 each Must try the "strawberry basil" it taste similar to a mojito. 
classy crowd 
good dancing
author: Stephanie B.

description: My girlfriend had her 23rd birthday here. The bouncers were the absolute best. The were so chill, attentive and just awesome. They danced with our group but also paid attention to every person who entered the VIP section. On top of that, they escorted my girlfriend to and from the dj booth every time she wanted to request a song.  All in all, if you want to spend some money and have a great night reserve a table at playland. Jermaine and Forrest  and the guys are awesome. Would recommend to a friend.
author: Brian M.

description: Best bar with dancing in the city! The service was great! The drinks were great! The multi rooms music was great. Lots of bathrooms. Great location.  Had a great time!
author: Rima D.

description:
We came here on Cinco de Mayo.  Awesome happy hour drink specials! Our bartender Ali was super friendly and mixed great drinks. We ordered cucumber mint & strawberry margaritas 
We used to come here for the dancing upstairs but they recently added a little whisky lounge in the back downstairs, I'll definitely be back check it out next time! Sundays are salsa night which we heard is fun so we might come back for that. 

Overall a great time with great drinks and atmosphere.
author: Kate S.

description:
You have to pay cover for a way too crowded bar with barbacks doing their best Frank Gore impression and barreling into the crowd for yardage after contact.

The dance floor is packed in a way that goes beyond enjoyable, but some people like the crush of people. I'm not one of them.
author: Misha T.

description:
If I could rate in half stars, I would give this 3.5 stars, but I had a good experience at Playland despite its drawbacks, so why not bump my rating? It's easy to break down my feedback for this place in a few points:

- LOVE the top 40s music and the fact that they showed music videos at the bar. Good dancing vibes.
- Small place and crowded but well-ventilated so can't complain.
- Bartenders were friendly and drinks were good. Nothing special.
- I hate that there is literally only one bathroom for the whole place. It can cause some crowding on the bottom floor.

As long as you get here early, it's not a bad place to be. Nice and basic clubbing experience guaranteed!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Most boring music I've ever heard. Couldn't even dance with the guy I met up with.... And music is key to having a good night out haha
author: Marianne G.

description:
Need to cap out how many people come into the bar. Whats the point of going in if its way too packed that you cant even move? 

Got my phone stolen literally within 15 minutes of being there. I know that isn't really the bars fault, however, it should deter vacationers from going places that they will be robbed from. (Kinda hard to vacation; Uber, Lyft, Find reviews, know what time it is, take photos without a phone)

HOT AS HELL.

The establishment was clan for the most part and had a good vibe. 

Probably wont come back because of the criminal demographic.
author: Maria Y.

description:
Love this place! There're two floors, the dance floor is on the second floor. It's really busy on Friday and Saturday, because it's (obviously) weekend and the music is cool! On Sunday they do Salsa Night  
Bartenders are fast and do good job! My favorite is Lana! 
And the cocktails!... Cocktails are A-MA-ZING!!! 

The negative thing people usually complain about is that restrooms are only on the first floor. 

So check it out;)
author: Tatiana P.

description:
I decided along with a few friends that we would be starting our night with playland bar. First off, the line was pretty long although it did move relatively quickly. Upon entering we were submerged in a sea of others trying to get drinks, waiting for the bathroom, or waiting on line to get upstairs. It was very crowded and I could not count how many bodies I bumped. We decided to make our way upstairs to see what the hype was about and as we reached the upstairs bar we began to realize that we would be screaming to communicate. It was just as packed as the downstairs and much harder to get a drink from the bar. 
This bar would be nice for younger college like students who don't mind grinding up on each other to make their way to a packed dance floor. For myself and my friends who have been out of college for a few years, this is not the scene for us.
author: Matthew H.

description:
You guys need some AC ! 
or at least put it on MAX or something 

i loved the bartender here :)
she was so nice and i loved what she recommended. 
I have no idea what that was, but she made some amazing drinks !
and it was only around $7 for a glass of cocktail (esp on friday night??) 
i do not remember her name 
.. but we were there around 10pm ? on Friday 
I would not mind going back just because the service was so nice
author: Yumi K.

description:
I left my ID in exchange for the copper cups. The cups were given to the upstairs bartender. I came back for my ID at 2:00AM and they said my ID is not there. Don't leave your ID with them.

Edit: I called the General Manager and he called me back a few days later and said they found my ID. He stated that there were over 200 IDs left there over the last few weeks and apologized for the inconvenience. For my efforts, he gave me a bottle. I changed my rating from a one star to a four star because of the generosity.
