Please come visit Livermore downtown and I'll be happy to reciprocate your generosity.
author: Christopher H.

description:
A perfect place for everybody! Want to dance? Go upstairs! Want to get a drink? Go to any of the three bars! Want to find new friends? Just spend a minute without moving! 
What I really love about this place is the atmosphere. Music is awesome, everyone's into the moment, people are cool, what else you can ask for? 
And the thing I MUST mention is the cutest and the friendliest bartender Lana. Her cocktails were perfectly made and her attitude to what she's doing is literally inspiring! She loves being there! 
Don't. Even. Think. 
Just go to Playland bar and make yourself a perfect night!
author: Yaroslava K.

description: This place is fun and frankly hilarious. It doesn't really feel like a place where locals hang out, so it's an excellent place to people watch. I love the bartenders and bouncers here though. My friend and I were in our normal night out attire, while everyone else seemed to have teleported from a Vegas nightclub, and we weren't treated any differently. The music here is a lot of fun and I'll definitely be back.
author: Tatiana J.

description: I'm rating based on day drinking, when I stumbled into Playland after Bay to Breakers (I liked that Polk St. wasn't the place to be post-run). Wow - those drinks were fantastic. I wish I could recall the cocktails my friends and I ordered, but they're all captured in my photo so you can admire their beauty and imagine how they taste going down. It's small so I'm unsure what'd it be like on a weekend with their DJ, but with an upstairs (like other reviewers mention) it could work. Go thirsty!
author: Amanda V.

description:
I've been coming to the Playland for over 2 years, it's usually a lot of fun. It's crowded, but there is a good ratio of girls / guys since there are no cover for girls and a $5 to $10 cover for guys.
But last night (03/05/16) 2 my friends got there phone stolen! One had left the purse on the side while dancing (ok not prudent but still..) the other had her phone in the back pocket most of the nigh. The thief did it a closing time. We realized that while leaving and the bouncer would not let us back in to check..

You cannot judge 100% based on looks, but there was pretty bad looking guys.. Who are you letting in Playland staff? I won't spend my money and energy at your place anymore!
author: Remi T.

description:
One of my favorite bars on Polk Street:) Ive been coming back here more and more oftenly now- particularly because of their paper board filled with creative special cocktails. love those. 
always colorful crowd, fun to watch. 
super nice bartenders - I know at least too- sweet and very professional Judith and Svitlana who works night shift, -that girl makes great suggestions and mean drinks:) I drink quite a bit but never sure what I want - annoying, so solid bartender always helps.
author: Liza B.

description: Was in the bar on a Sunday night, watching football.  The bar transitioned from a casual crowd watching the game to their salsa night.  Douche Bag bald door security guy cards me while I have already been drinking (with a drink at the bar in front of me).  So since I'm 40 it's no problem for me to enjoy my adult beverage thank you!  He approaches me 3mins later to ask me to remove the beenie I've been wearing in there the last 90mins.  I say no, stand up, walk away from my nearly full drink, and walk out.  True Story, no exaggeration at all.  I have 4 friends coming into town this week, and guess what bar on Polk we'll skip!?     "F!"
author: Zabour W.

description: Love this place - all the times I've been here, I've never had to pay cover. Aside from that, drinks aren't cheap and the place can get packed. But if you're down for loud music and fun, make sure you check it out!
author: Erika D.

description:
What bar can you go to for a fun night out on Polk Street with the best bartenders and happy hour?? 

PLAYLAND. 

This craft cocktail bar has a variety of drinks on their menu ( try "Karl the Fog" and you won't be disappointed). I like going during karaoke night on Tuesday nights because it's always amusing watching drunk people belt out their best (or worst) version of "Don't Stop Believing" plus Cat is behind the bar and she makes awesome drinks and is always fun to talk to. I've also been here during weekend nights. It gets crowded so come early. The music and vibe is always great!
author: Ronald L.

description: The stamp they gave me when I got in rubbed off on my jacket, when I tried to get in again, the bouncers were giving me nothing but attitude and treating me like a child even though, the girls I was with had stamps too and he saw me come in. He continued to claim he never saw me while at the same time laughing at me. He eventually let me in but I honestly think he just enjoys giving drunk girls a hard time.
author: Anastasia R.

description:
Playland Bar is not a bad bar to hit up if you're trying to go for pretty good drinks and have some good music to dance to. 

Downstairs the bar is a lot less empty and less crowded if you are just looking for a place to drink and chill. Upstairs is where the music is blasting and people are dancing. Be warned that the bar on the side needs $20 minimum to use your card and the bar in the middle is cash only. 

The bar accommodated our 20 guests very easily and somehow my party even got an entire section on the couch. It can get very crowded out on the dance floor, but if you are a type who doesn't like to get touched or gets annoyed being pushed accidentally, then you are obviously at the wrong place and might as well go to a smaller bar not on Polk Street.
author: Tina K.

description: Playland has been one of my favorite spots in SF since their establishment back sometime in 2012.. Now I hear a lot of complaints about this place but you really have to try it more than once to appreciate it. And honestly come on an off night that isn't Fri/Sat night, when the crowds from all around the bay area know to hit up this hot nightlife spot! They have latin night Sundays, board game night on Mondays and my favorite ladies night Thursdays. One of the reasons this place is my favorite is that they make a variety of different craft cocktails that are O so very tasty! Seriously try one of their egg white drinks you won't be disappointed. With a big projection screen to watch all the big games now and even on Fri/Sat the downstairs lounge and back room are perfect to sit with your crew or get to know that special person you perhaps met on the dance floor;) The staff is all very friendly and if your around enough they will appreciate your face!
author: Gabriel V.

description: Overall Good music, good drinks, they OVERCHARGED me A LOT on my card!!! they added more to the tip I had wrote !!!! not right!!!!!!!!!!!! WATCH OUT
author: Lils A.

description: Came in with a group of friends, only to have the bouncer accuse my friend of having a fake ID. They need to understand not everyone from out of state has a fake ID. I am sorry but they really need to upgrade their scanner or hire bouncers who are confident enough to tell which the real from the fake IDs are. If you have an out of state ID, good luck trying to get in.
author: Elisa C.

description: Absolutely lovely!my favorite spot for drinks in SF!I Really like the atmosphere there!Great music.Bartenders are so super friendly and knowledgeable!Drinks are truly awesome!!!Highly recommend !
author: Alena P.

description: I really liked Playland. The drinks were good and so was the dancing and dj. Definitely watch your purse though. My friend's phone and my phone were both stolen out of our purses. The security team and staff were super helpful in trying to find them, although unsuccessful.
author: Kristen L.

description: Christian was a great help in finding my lost debit card and very courteous.  He also gave me great advice on surrounding establishments.  I really appreciated his bar and customer service skills.  If you're looking for a bar in the area I highly recommend Playland.
author: Jackie S.

description:
I was surprised how awesome this bar was. 

1) Great music. Upbeat top 40s and house/dance, pretty much every single hit from the past year that played on the radio that you could dance to. 

2) Delicious drinks. BEST LONG ISLAND I'VE EVER HAD!!!!!! 

3) Cool corner window on the second floor which overlooks Pine & Polk St...a fun place for an Instagram pic. 

4) Dance floor. It was on the other side of the bar which was kind of annoying when it was so crowded, but how many bars have a dance floor?!  The best of both worlds!

Obviously this place isn't for you if you hate top 40s and dancing, but for everyone else this bar is a winner!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Since moving to the City not too long ago, this has been my 'go to' spot. You can always count on good service from all the staff. The music is always on point as well. The crowd is typically aged 21-30ish. It's also totally worth coughing up the extra money to get bottle service. Not only do you actually have space in the crowded upstairs area, but also the bouncers are super cool and Catalina (the hostess) is Vegas material (nice, helpful and super gorgeous). 10/10 bar/club.
author: Kyler K.

description:
A group of 15 of us came here for a friends Bday party on a Saturday night. We gloriously took over the James Polk Room in the back of the bottom floor, where our lovely bartender, Yana, showed us her amazing bartending skills. 

She makes the best bullet bourbon Manhattans and made my friend a really nice tequila old fashion, which I had for the first time. Exceptional. The lighting was dim and the music was chill, so it was a perfect environment for catching up with friends before beast mode. 

Come beast mode, we went upstairs and basically took over again, slowly forming our little dance circle that everyone eventually hates but wants to join. We couldn't help it, the DJ was on point with his mainstream/house playlist. Even I got down, and I usually don't get down because I'd rather eat Hot Cheetos.

You never know what to expect on Polk street in terms of quality women, but at Playland you can always expect to find cute and classy chicks that love to dance. I would attribute this to great DJ's, the quality drinks, the cover they charge men, and the seats they make available to people who don't care for VIP tables. 

At the end of the night, we waited outside and gathered up all the wounded members and even the bouncers were chill and polite. This was impressive because if you've ever been to Ruby Sky, you'd agree with me then buy me a drink.  

Playland is a great spot if you are with a group and want solid cocktails at an affordable price in a sexy club scene. Otherwise you can go to Ruby Sky and get crappy cocktails at a ridiculous price and be overwhelmed by dudes and stuck up bouncers. 

I also recommend Topsy's bar on Kearny street which is under the same ownership.
author: Jesse W.

description: Good times over here! Tasty drinks, great service  big difference from day and night.
author: Beto Q.

description: My friends and I came here Friday night because we wanted to go out somewhere near where we were staying. As soon as we got there, there was a long line, but it only took about 10 minutes to get in. When we did get in, there was another long line to just get upstairs, which we later found out was to the dance floor. We got drinks at the downstairs bar and then decided to go upstairs to see why there was a line for it. When we got up there, it was very packed. Oh... I forgot to add, it is disgustingly hot in there... The bar as a whole is very college-like, we're not really into this kind of bar, so can't say we enjoyed it, but if you're into that kind of scene, this is the bar for you!
author: Steven P.

description: Not only is Cameron the cutest bartender at Playland, he's also the most capable. He created the house special, SF Sunset, with ease. He also was able create a delicious specialty cocktail on the spot. He provided the best customer service to us and all the patrons around us. I will surely come back for the great service.
author: Lori C.

description:
Was in town for Bay to Breakers and ended up coming to this location after desperately looking for somewhere to party on a Sunday Night. 
Arrived to bar around 10-ish and the place was soo dead, it was discouraging, but my group was in a mood to dance so we stayed and found our way upstairs. 
It was SALSA night on Sunday and lemme tell you I danced the entire time! Dance floor was SUPER empty when we first got there, but as the bouncers advised around 11-1130 things began to get crackin!
Music was really good, well ventilated upstairs so even though it was crowded and I know I was dancing up a storm, I still looked presentable (even thou I was hella sweaty).
The only down fall would be drinks...a bit pricy considering the size. The bartender working that Sunday was super cute (  he owes me a dance btw HOLLA!) and hooked it up with a round, (must of been our groups awesome washing-machine spins).
The guys there were like vultures, but some had some serious dance moves. 
Overall had a GREAT time! People were relatively nice, easy to dance with, Bounce staff was super cool, and the music was great! If I ever go back to San Fran, will definitely go back to this place!
author: Kenia R.

description: Playland has good music! And it was our first time here and our bartender Ali is the best! He took care of us and has a specialty cocktail it's amazing! Ask for it and he will whip it up for you. (; #teamali
author: Joanne C.

description:
Playland was fun but just an FYI for anyone who plans on going  and any managers/owners.

The guys at the front door will try to short you your change for the cover charge. For attendees, count your change and call them out. Managers/owners, you should start counting the money you're receiving from the door charge -- you might not be getting all that you're due.

Specifically, the tall guy on Friday night (5/6/16) around 11pm.
author: J D.

description:
This place is ridiculously crowded.  It is probably the biggest dancing bar on Polk St, but at the cost of cover and not being able to move.  First off, there is cover of $5 after a certain time (I believe somewhere between 10-11pm).  Don't forget this is for a bar/small dance floor.  The downstairs portion is not very big and can probably fit 50 people.  You usually have to wait in line to go upstairs, which could be a 1 or 5 minute wait.  Once you finally get upstairs, it's jam packed with people.  There is a 2nd bar upstairs and if you make your way to the dance floor, it will be very hard to move in there.  

Not my favorite location when coming to Polk, but I will come here on occasions.
author: Justin Y.

description: Worked with the manager, Reuben, to plan my 30th birthday party on the 2nd floor of the bar and the experience was great. The space was perfect for our event -- plenty of room to dance, great DJ, central location on Polk, and a dedicated bar. We did a 7-10pm buyout on a Saturday night and continued with bottle service afterwards; worked out really well. They let us bring in outside food, cupcakes and a few decorations which people loved. Generally, I'd highly recommend buying-out this space for a group of 50-60.
author: Carolyn B.

description:
3.5 stars. This bar has multiple personalities - downstairs is a pretty small bar area with theme-parked themed drinks (think: cotton candy and other major sweetness). Upstairs is more clubby with a dance floor area, louder DJ, main bar area, and smaller cash-only bar near the dance floor.

We were here on a Friday night and cover was $5 for guys to get upstairs but free for the ladies. The crowd upstairs was dressed a bit clubbier than what I've usually seen on Polk (except for maybe at Mayes). The drinks were alright and they were able to transfer tabs between downstairs and upstairs (which I actually thought they might not be able to do). However, it took way too long to order drinks at the upstairs bar and, when their printer wasn't working, they just scrawled a random-looking amount on a blank piece of paper and had me sign it as my receipt. Hopefully things here are usually in better working order.
author: Meghan P.

description: Fun spot. Bartenders are super nice.  I had an old-fashioned drink which tasted delicious. One of the best I had in a while.  Worth checking out.
author: Nicholas R.

description: This place is cool because there's a normal bar downstairs and the upstairs has another bar and an area to dance. It can get pretty crowded on Fridays and Saturdays but they have good drinks and an upbeat vibe. The people working there are also very fun and helpful. I was actually in there last night and there was a really awesome bartender (I think her name was Olga) working the bar upstairs. She was super nice and made the extra effort to make sure everyone got their drinks in an orderly manner while keeping us entertained. I would definitely recommend this place to friends who want a lively night out in SF!
author: Kenan P.

description:
Came here on a weekend night with my friends. 

Coat check girl was sick which sucked because we had to carry our coats around. 
( We ended up just putting all our coats in a pile upstairs and no one touched them )
They have a bar upstairs and downstairs and plenty of seating everywhere. 

Upstairs has a dance floor and the most fantastic ac vent ever.  I literally just stood under it half the time I was there because it was so hot everywhere else. 
The dj played a great mix of music ( hip hop, mashups, a little old school, edm , etc) 

Drinks are decently priced $10 for long island, $7 for a g&t. 
The bartenders were great !!!! They dealed with the crowd so well ( it was nye ) and we were 
The crowd was a great mix of 20s - 30s. 
There is usually no cover but apparently, they sometimes charge a small cover for 
guys to go upstairs. 

Drinks are pretty strong :) great place to go to dance or even to start our your night.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
BEST. SPOT. EVER. 

Why, you may ask, why do I love this place so? Simple!!!

1) FABULOUS MUSIC: I was dancing to Kanye West one minute to Deadmau5 the next! 

2) EASY TO GET IN: There's a bar downstairs, and then an upstairs level which is a simple staircase away. Get here early to avoid having a headache getting in! 

3) VENTILATION: No really. There are windows open on the top level, and air conditioning is blasting. I think this might be the most underrated aspect of this place! You can actually breathe while dancing! 

4) BARTENDERS: They spot you, they serve you! 



Having my birthday party here so I will be leaving an updated review post event! :)
author: Raji R.

description:
Here's the Story:
I came here with a few friends for a meetup.com event and it was a social gathering.  The place is pretty spacious.  2 floors with a bar on each.  I'd say that it can fit about 200+ people total.  I can't speak to the alcohol, but the decor and ambiance was nice.  The dim lights made for a more classic and old feel to it.  I would come back next time as I'm sure it turns into a club or lounge setup on the weekends at night.
author: Michael W.

description:
I've been here a few times in the past few months (just to the bar--not to the club upstairs) and consistently enjoyed it. It is neither so trendy that it veers into d-bag hipster excess, nor is it a gimmicky tourist orgy like McTeague's down the street.

The bartenders (especially Yuliya) have all been perfect pros and the cocktails I've tried have been superb, and most of the other patrons have been agreeable and worth talking to. It doesn't draw too much of any one crowd to become tedious.
author: Nick H.

description: Shout out to Ariel, dope bartender! Couldn't have a cooler bartender who talked to us and didn't just care about making drinks! Need more bartenders like her!
author: Carlos P.

description: Probably the worst lounge I've been to, granted I went on a Saturday night. $10 cover to go inside to possibly the most crowded dance floor I've ever seen. The sheer density of people... I was being puppeteered by the mass of bodies around me. Plus, the drinks were more expensive than they're worth. Lastly, the music wasn't even good.
author: Ruobin W.

description: Mezcal lover. All day. Good music and service. Nice space for a small group.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
I finally had the opportunity to visit Playland last night.  I must say that this is very good place to go to on the weekends.  It doesn't get crowd like Maye's.  The staff are pretty cool and I like the fact that it's a 2 story building.  You can dance on the 2nd floor or just chill and relax on the 1st.

I look forward to my next visit to Playland.  :-)
author: Alex W.

description:
San Francisco is seldom over 70 degrees. When it is though? 
BUST OUT THE HOOCHIE CLOTHES. 

Beach apparel: shorts so short they're practically coochie cutters with butt cleavage hanging out, bikini top with a sheer blouse tossed over it.. Oh, I still have walk of shame hair from being a hot drunken mess last night? Toss on a Fedora hat. 

I headed off to the beach to get down to my skivvies and roast for a bit. I'm probably the tannest Chinese girl I know. I don't mean that spray tan fake bake shit either. 
Damn. I have to get going to GNO. No time to go home and change into slut gear for clubbing/bars/lounges. 

*shrugs* Susy Effing C doesn't give a eff!! 

"No 5a5 or Jones for you. You ain't gettin in anywhere dressed like that!"

Pshhh watch me. No dress code fosho! 

Playland. No dress code. No cover. Room to dance. No cute guys.

Just a token Asian girl dressed as a hipster beach bum...at least it didn't smell like poop inside like at Mcteagues.
author: Susy C.

description:
If you're looking for a night of bar dancing with a fun crowd of guys and girls, this is your spot!

Came here on a Saturday night with a group of guy friends and had a blast. The night started off slow in the James Polk Room in the back of the ground floor, where we were treated to great drinks by the awesome bartenders. Then the action moved upstairs, where we danced till late. There were a couple of rude assholes (as is to be expected at a spot like this in SF), but for the most part, crowd was fun and gentle(wo)manly. 

Also could see myself come here for a chill drink or two earlier in the night.
author: Balu C.

description:
Steadily becoming one of my favorite go-to bars in the city both on weeknights and weekends.

Enjoyed the crowded bar downstairs, the dance floor upstairs, and it's an excellent venue to rent out for a big party. No question, that was the best (thank you to the Flight Crew).  Good location and just a touch classier than the usual Polk spots which seems to draw higher caliber men and women.

Two Tips:

(1) Just order regular mixed drinks. This isn't Rickhouse, Comstock, B&B, etc. They make strong but solid drinks, but they are usually packed. Ordering something that requires "muddling" might get you junk punched. (it's still Polk Street you know) :-)

(2) Do not expect to make it to the bathroom. or even know that there is a huge line for the bathroom. Just go next door.
author: Mike V.

description:
STAY AWAY FROM HERE. I have had my cell phone stollen from out of my purse - while wearing it cross body! - on TWO separate occasions within this past year!!!!! 
On both occasions, I had only been at the bar for about 45 minutes before it was stollen. (I was not drunk. I am very aware of my surroundings and overly cautious). 

First time... Ok, maybe it was bad luck. Second time... Something seems very sketchy. Especially when none of the employees or managers were surprised. I have only been to this bar 3 times- and I will never go back again! 

The guards and manager did nothing to help at the time of the incident and were very nonchalant during the entire situation. The manager said "Oh, yeah you are the 4th person so far tonight that has complained about a stollen phone..." (It was only 10:30 at night and they already had 4 stollen phones...)

I wish I could leave zero stars.
author: Evelyn S.

description:
I almost gave this place 2 stars, but I decided to be nice. Only because I did end up meeting some pretty awesome, hilarious and entertaining people here the night we came here. BUT I will say that those people we magically found were in the minority since most people in this bar I definitely a) do not think wanted to be there since they still kept all of their jackets and scarves on and such; b) looked so uncomfortable with super closed bodies and just looking awkward; and c) they were definitely on the younger side overall. So would I come back here? probably not. 

BUT beers are $5 which is decent for SF and mixed drinks are $7 and they are decently strong. All female bartenders though, so you can tell who this place caters to ha ha  The other annoying thing was the bathroom was downstairs away from the music upstairs and you have to go through security sort of again too when you want to go back upstairs, and if you are a woman and pee as much as I do, you know how much that can suck. Oh and they have a crazy artic chill wind AC system. The second that bad boy turns on, it is like Playland is trying to film a music video or something since it is so incredibly strong and blows everyone's hair all around. So intense! There is really no need for that. 

Lastly, no clue why this place is called playland other than the one creepy clown face that serves as a decoration on the bar. That is just scary.
author: Sarah G.

description: Playland is a great bar. The crowd is always good and there is an upstairs with another bar and dancing. Playland has a good. Playland is located in the heart of the Polk nightlife too. The bar tenders and staff are also great.
author: Brendan C.

description: Great spot to grab an early midweek drink. Weekends get crowded, but understandable due to the cross section / Polk and Pine
author: Reza O.

description:
While the cat's away, the mouse will PLAY at the newest HOTSPOT in sNob Hill: Playland! 

PLAY at the bar.

PLAY with the cute and friendly suspender-wearing bartenders.

PLAY with the DJ.

PLAY on the dance floor. 

PLAY with the boys; all 31 flavors of them. Ummm, did I say boys? I meant girls. =X

PLAYing has never been so fun!

Shhhh, please don't tell Mr. NSS though. He was asleep while I was at PLAY.

Yes, I'm a bad, bad girl.

P.S. - One of these days, I swear my reviews will get me in trouble. 

OTHER NOTES: 
*No cover.
*No dress-code.
*Crackin' on a Saturday night. 
*Mixed crowd in their 20s-30s with mainly the Marina I Felta Thi frat boys (we were the token Asian girls).
*Bar meets lounge meets small club with 2 levels, 2 bars, flat screen TVs (ehh ESPN playing?!?!?), retro burgundy leather couches, and a ventilated dance floor on the second level. 
*DJ spinning Top 40s & Dance music: Rihanna's "Where Have You Been", JLo's "Dance Again", Nicki Minaj's "Starships", Usher's "Scream", Havana Brown's "We Run the Night", David Guetta's "Titanium", and etc.
*CHEAP DRINKS: $7-8/shot for top shelf liquor (we got two DOUBLE shots of Goose for $30).
*$20 minimum for credit cards. 
*Long line for the restroom; just one stall for each sex (BOO!) 
*Parking sucks. No nearby parking lot. Cab it.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Came to watch Game 6 of the World Series here! Great bar area, open space - great for groups, fast service, GREAT prices and the alcohol selection was on key! 

Only reason the place gets 4 instead of 5 stars - THEY DON'T SERVE FOOD during the week, at least they didn't when I went to watch the game there. I had to go across the street to snag a slice of Pizza.
author: Amy K.

description:
Thursday night was good for our group since it was our first night together. I think we showed up around 10PM and expected to be at Playland for a little and bounce around Polk St but we ended up staying all night! The bar upstairs is usually packed but they move pretty quick.

There is a downstairs which feels more like a lounge and then an upstairs which is more like a club with some pretty great throwback music videos that play but it is pretty typical with sticky counters and dim lighting. We stayed upstairs in their "VIP" area since we were a large group and no one was there so we just danced around by ourselves until the place filled up which is did by about 11:30! Then we got our fair share of groups that wanted to congratulate the bride (since we were wearing bridesmaid headbands) and leave some single guys with us which isn't really my idea of a good time but they were definitely good sports. Somehow the DJ caught on that our group was from Miami and a lot of Pitbull and Enrique got played.....

Overall, it was pretty great for us. We danced the night away and had plenty of drinks and was a better experience than I have had there in the past. Wish the line for the bathroom would go a little faster but that is my only gripe!
author: Irene S.

description:
Grimy and sketchy with lots of interesting characters, but definitely fun. This is basically a club but not too clubby aka no need to get dressed up or anything, just a nice place to jump around after you've barhopped. I'd recommend ending the night here as my friends and I did and it was so much fun. They play some top 40 as well as old school hip hop/R&B with a good dose of Justin Timberlake. My kind of place.

Be warned that upstairs (where you dance) gets pretty packed and it's not that easy to get a drink.
author: Lulu P.

description:
I'd been meaning to check out this bar for the longest time and I'm glad I finally did this past weekend. The music was a nice mix of hip-hop, EDM and a few of the latest pop hits. The DJ did a great job of transitioning from track to track and the music was oh so danceable! The other awesome part was that ladies got in free on a Saturday night! And before I forget, there was a midnight special for $5 fireball shots. What's not to love?

The only downside is that the upstairs dance floor gets packed so it's hard to move around. But it was obvious everyone was having a good time. Definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a place to go dancing with your girlfriends.
author: Preethi S.

description:
If you're looking for your basic clubby Saturday night experience this place is worth a shot. It has two levels, with the upstairs hosting a cramped dance floor playing modern pop hits. 

I showed up around 9:45, which is absurdly early apparently because I was greeted with a nearly empty club. All the bartenders upstairs were eager to take my drink order, and my friend and I sat at a table for about twenty minutes commenting on the lack of people, debating about whether or not we should leave and try another spot, and getting distracted by the big screen televisions playing music videos. 

We eventually started talking to someone in our vicinity and the place suddenly filled to the brim with people. It was like a torrential flood of people came through the doors ready to down shots of Fireball and grind on random people on the dance floor. I decided to attempt to dance with my friend, but it was so packed we could barely move, and guys came at us from every angle trying to ask us questions which we couldn't hear over the excessively loud tunes. We decided to venture downstairs, which was significantly less packed but had a completely different vibe. We went back upstairs and decided to get another drink, which was shockingly easy and quick given there is only one bar upstairs and the place was packed. The bartenders actually remembered us, which I appreciated. Not the best experience but certainly not a bad night.
author: Emily D.

description:
Super fun! Been there both on weekends and weeknights. Divey-ish lax bar on the weeknights where it's not too loud to talk and not too crowded to find a seat at the bar, fun dance party on the weekends with strong drinks to enhance the night.

It's not a lounge. It's not a club. As long as your expectations are set right, this place is definitely high energy fun with low-key nights during the week. Drinks are delicious and rather creative for just another pac heights bar.
author: Alice Z.

description: Walked in to have a drink with a friend on a Sunday afternoon. Female bartender asked for my ID, no problem. Asked for another ID and I tell her I don't have one. I mean, why of course should she need another one. Had to go through my Facebook to get her to leave me alone. Suffice it to say, I didn't order another drink.
author: Kaz K.

description:
PLAYtime!

Polk street has a wide selection of bars but I always enjoy coming here. The bar is located near the north section of polk street. 

The bar has two levels and a back area that has a more speakeasy feel to it. The drinks are also great. Well crafted cocktails for polk street. 

The upstairs is basically a dance floor where the play top hits, hip hop, and electronic music. I enjoy the crowd here and it caters to a good mix of age groups from early 20's to early 30's. 

There's also three bar areas so it's quite easy to get a drink. Bartenders are also friendly.

Overall the place is definitely worth checking out when your in polk next time.
author: Stephen C.

description: I was impressed with the music selection but the place was tiny.  It would have been nice if they opened up the upstairs earlier in the night as we had to wait until 9:00 before being able to dance.
author: Allison A.

description: Small, clean, friendly staff, decent prices. Stopped in while walking by. Will seek out again when in the area.
author: Daniel D.

description: Place was PACKED!! Just moved to San Francisco and this was my first time going out. The DJ was JAMMIN and the crowd was good. The bartenders were fast and attentive. I enjoyed the dance floor and music. Barely room to dance but it's ok because you're there for a good time with friends anyway.
author: Shannon C.

description:
I'm a fan of how lay back Playland is on a Sunday afternoon. Came here after Halloween costume shopping with a friend, Jasmin took care of us with just the right amount of attention. There are few TVs at the bar too, so there were people catching the game. Totally the best place to chill and rest after shopping.

Weekend nights, however, are the polar opposite. The downstair bar is manageable, but there will be people jumping all over the 2nd floor... Hm, I'll stick with the afternoon crowd, thanks.
author: Lois W.

description: Friend dragged me in bc she used to work here.  Almost tripped on a pile of peasants.  Never again.
author: Anna D.

description:
Are you looking for a bar with Jagermeister on tap? Well say hello to Playland. 

Came here for a beer run and I must commend the staff for being very accommodating to 20 or so runners flooding the bar at the same time; ordering waters with their beers. The bar is comfortable and definitely looks spiffier than Kimos before but at the same time, it also feels a little sterile in comparison. At least it's clean. 

Nice selection of beers on tap, friendly bartenders, and ummm nice hardwood floors - one more watering hole to consider as you crawl up and down Polk Street.
author: Jon L.

description:
This review is for the reservable back room and bottle service. I reserved the back lounge on the first floor for my birthday night. It was very affordable - we had bottle service - and the area is very spacious and can sit about 10 to 15 people. 

The customer service was exceptional. The manager was very friendly and answered all of my questions beforehand. They even checked up on us several times to make sure we were not running low on alcohol :) The best part of reserving the back space is that you have the option to use the beer pong table, so we had a lot of fun with that. I even received contact from the manager the day after my night out at Playland to make sure I had a good time! I highly recommend this back space for anyone who wants to reserve the space.

The rest of the bar and dance floor is insanely packed since it has gotten increasingly popular lately. I am not into rubbing shoulders with everyone and standing in line just to get to the dance floor, but we were able to get wrist bands to bypass the line because of the room we reserved, which was nice.
author: Corabel S.

description:
I always have fun partying on Polk St but last Friday was my first time at Playland. 

FUN. FUN. FUN

Pro:
no cover
super casual (my bff went in with a giants hat)
cheap drinks
three bars (one downstairs & 2 upstairs)
huge dance floor upstairs

Con:
Too much guys
kinda crowded but okay

Definitely had fun last weekend and wouldn't mind going back there again. I think its even better than Vertigo since the dance floor is much BIGGER!
author: Carol Y.

description:
Drinks? Yes. 
Bartender? Awesome. 
Aesthetic? Great. 
Board game selection? Fun. 

Definitely going to be back.
author: Marissa H.

description:
Most incompetent bouncers I've ever seen in my LIFE. My friend had a computer bag, the bouncer called him gay, and wouldn't let him in with his fiancé. 

I mean, if you're bald and in you're mid40s (and eating M&Ms .... FYL), and this is what you have as a career, I guess that's cool. Slash, you're a bouncer. 

Stop the real jerks on Polk street - not the professionals who keep your sorry ass bar alive.
author: Taylor L.

description: I am a bit new to the SF night scene, but I am still confused why a bar has a cover. I thought it was rather annoying to wait in line and pay a cover to get inside the bar. Seems to defeat the point of a bar. But I came here at 12:30am on a Friday night and the place was packed! I can't say that it has cool decor or anything too exciting, nor is the music too amazing. However, the bartender we had was awesome!!! She recommended a mint-cucumber-vodka and it hit the spot. I loved it. I don't know the girls name, but I'll post a photo of her, so if you find her, she is great!
author: Nikita K.

description: Such a fun place to go to! I had my friends meet me here for my birthday and we had a blast. Great music, great environment!
author: Daniella G.

description:
Went here last night for the first time. Cool vibe. Downstairs was more of a lounge type settings and the upstairs is more of a night club. You get the best of both worlds. Bartenders seemed kinda clueless at times, but it was real busy. The bouncers were cool. Major props to them. Some jerk grabbed my ass and one of the bouncers was quick to grab the guy and kick him out. He even checked up on me later to see if everything was alright. It's a safe place. Had a great time. Definitely will come back. 

I would give it 5 stars, but it gets too crowded and steaming hot.
author: Camille Y.

description:
Thank you Taylor L. I was the "man with the bag" she referenced in her review. 
I will never go back here. The bouncer was completely sexist and intimidated by me because I was carrying a small computer bag after coming directly from work. I opened my bag and offered to have them check the contents, but they refused. I was told I was not allowed inside because I was "a man with a bag". I recommend any other men who work for a living avoid this bar until the management replace the door staff with more competent and accepting of others in this very diverse city of ours.
author: Jeremie B.

description:
Crowded but pretty good bar + dancing place in the midst of Polk Street.

Four stars for the cover on Saturday night and shutting down at 1 AM.  But as good as you're probably going to get in SF.
author: Daniel Y.

description: Went to playland bar a month ago on a friday night and it wasn't a good experience. Everyone at the bar is rude including the people standing outside and letting you in. One of them blamed my friend saying he didn't pay even though he did. Drinks are ok , upstairs section is too crowded, they keep directing you elsewhere. Not worth paying to get in ! Go to other bars in the neighborhood insted.
author: Priyanka P.

description:
Maybe it was because it was 1:30am and there were crowds of young people pushing each other around, but I didn't have that great of a time at the Playland Bar. 

Ambiance (3 stars): The first floor is a bar where you can order some cocktails and hang out at the bar with some friends. If you go up to the second floor you will find a club like atmosphere with a DJ and about 2-3 bars. We were here on a Friday night and it was PACKED with people. People pouring drinks, laughing, jumping, and honestly, really having a great time. I was able to meet up with my friends and had a couple of shots with my boyfriend at the bar. Although I am being shoved left and right, I tried to enjoy the scenery and environment. A couple of strangers came up and tried to strike up a conversation, I played along to do the same.

5 minutes into being on the second floor, my friend finds that her iphone has been stolen. After searching the floors we find out that another girl has had her phone stolen out of her purse. This place was so packed that there was nothing that we could do to find the phones again. Someone had obviously been going around nabbing phones from girls purpose. Not cool. 

I am not blaming the business itself for losing the phone, there was little that they could do. The place was so packed though that there was little space to move around. The place felt very much above capacity and it made it difficult even for people to stand around. 

The employees could do little about it and then they started to move us out to the street. The bouncer moved us across the street by the end of the night. We were sober, one of us phoneless, and had been pushed around way too many times. 

Just a note: come here to drink. Protect your stuff. Bring a clutch with a zipper.
author: Ivy T.

description: A perfect place to end a weekend in San Francisco! A friend and I enjoyed their special (A craft beer + shot of Jameson for $10) while watching football and everything about this bar left a perfect first impression. The music was good and at a perfect volume. The service received was fast and friendly enough to give us out of towners tips on places to go and things to see. The location itself is great as there are many surrounding restaurants and places to eat if you don't want bar food. I only have good things to say and without a doubt I'll be paying them another visit whenever I'm back in the area.
author: Denise V.

description:
Free for women, $5 cover for men.
With a door charge like that, you can bet this place usually gets packed full of girls looking to have a good time, and men eager to make sure they get it. Wink, wink, nudge, nudge.

I love Playland. It's sort of like a less rapey DNA Lounge. The dance floor usually gets pretty packed, the two different levels allow for varying experiences of drinking (more loungey downstairs, more party-hard upstairs), and the clientele are usually of the classier variety (though I suppose everyone looks the same when you're too hammered to notice or care).

This is one of my group of friends' go to spots over the weekend. There's always tons of new people to meet, I always seem to run into friends, and we always have a great time here. I like having the option to either lounge on one of the chairs by the windows, or to knock back a few drinks and dance like crazy with my buddies and girlfriends.

If you're looking for a place to meet cool people, there are *definitely* a few cute guys here. It gets pretty packed, but who says that's a bad thing, right?
author: Sherilynn M.

description:
Great mix of music. Love that they play house pretty regularly. Not too many creepers. Drinks aren't that expensive. Favorite place of Polk.

Upstairs dance floor is pretty bomb.
author: Bianca D.

description:
I came here with some friends on a Saturday Night. We were recommended Polk Street bars by some locals and we weren't disappointed.

Parking was all street and took a while but we managed to park a block away.  

The bottom bar was very laid back and not too busy.  The top bar and dance floor area was way more packed.  The music was fun and a mix of EDM/pop mash ups & hip hop.  The dance floor was really small but the air conditioning eased the discomfort of being squished around in the crowd.  There's lots of places to sit all around - AWESOME.  The crowd was a mix of young 20-30's.  Drinks weren't very strong though but it was still fun enough where that didn't matter! 

I would definitely return.
author: Tam N.

description:
3.5 Stars

This place is a fun place to be on a thursday night or through out the weekend. It has two floors; first floor is strictly a bar, while 2nd floor has a dance floor + live DJ and another bar! 

Fortunatly, I was early and the bar was not too crowded, so I did not have to pay for a cover charge... but 15 minutes after I got there, boom! Groups of people started showing up and the dance floor filled up! The DJ plays popular EDM songs or club remixes of top 40 songs... nothing too special about that. But hey, it music you can dance to so that is always good!
The club has its own photographer that walks around and ask groups for pictures! So if you go one night, your face might show up on their website!

Their bar is nice too; however, shots are a bit pricy. I was charged $7 for a mixed drink (woohoo! cheap!) but also $7 for just a shot of whiskey?? Oh well. Their bartenders will get to you pretty quick and they are super nice. However, when I gave them my credit card to pay for my drink, I expected them to give it back... but they just opened a tab without asking. Good thing I asked for it back after order number two because I would not have remembered about it as the night progressed. That being said, a lot of my friends forgot their credit cards there (but we called them the next day and they told us we can pick the cards up).

Lastly... this place closes at 1am! Definitely too early for a bar in SF...
author: Jessica L.

description: Went there for dancing, not impressed. Bar downstairs was cool, old-fashioned and everything hardwood, barista was really cool. Upstairs the space was too small for dancing and squeezed between two walls of couches, felt kind of awkward dancing with people sitting there looking at me. Music was way too loud, there was karaoke which I didn't stick around to hear. Left at around 10:30 bc not impressed.
author: Anon Y.

description: This place is so crowded on the weekend. It has good music but is too small upstairs where the dance floor is. You can't even get through without pushing everyone to the ground seriously. I wouldn't go back to this bar that often since is so hard to even get out or even go in.
author: Marian P.

description:
This place is located right on Polk Street and is good for a night of dancing to theTop 40s and staples of the past couple decades.  The first floor is a pretty chill bar, and the second floor is crowded with DJ, dancing, and more drinks.  The drinks are affordable but taste watered down.  The top floor gets pretty gross by the end of the night, and the place had lights on and kicked us out before 1:30am on Halloween night!  Not cool.

Overall, decent place for standard drinks and dancing.
author: Carrie C.

description: Playland is one of my favorite bars to go to with friends! The dancing and music are awesome, and I have met some really great people there. The service is also fantastic, which is always a plus. One of the bartenders, Ariel, was so sweet and we had a great conversation about our experiences in Ireland and here in San Francisco! She also told me they had Guinness which I then ordered immediately, and it was amazing! Definitely a great bar, and I would recommend it to anyone.
author: Katy D.

description:
Well for starters it says I have multiple check ins here yet I can only remember coming here last night. I'd say that Playland is part of a good night.

From what I remember of last night, this place was calm downstairs and bumping upstairs. Granted this place is a bit small and narrow, it does have a bar on both floors. The bartender downstairs is a super chill Russian lady. I mean she's SUPER chill, my friends were belligerent last night. Pretty sure one of my friends would call her "my Love." For HOURS this poor bartender has this scrawny asian with his slick hair ordering Jameson shots and calling her a variety of flirtatious names.

The drinks here were good. The shots were strong (didn't feel like they were watered down or anything), and their mixed drinks here are BOMB. The Russian Bear was practically an alcoholic key lime pie in liquid form. THAT SHIT CRAY! 

Alright, I'm calm now...

To sum it all up, I came here with a group of 10. Spent countless dollars on shots and thoroughly enjoyed the night. Saw multiple friends black out thanks to the heavy pouring of Ina the Russian bartender.


I will say that the bathroom was filthy. I can't blame the establishment, it was the people who happened to be here that night. Some girl trashed the bathroom by leaving their monthly wiping on the top of the toilet.... Like seriously... WHAT THE F#@K. That's just filthy. Vulgar. Offensive. Down right wrong. I don't care how drunk you are, who does that. Shameful.
author: Karma B.

description: The DJ played really good music last night and we got bottle service pretty fast. My complaint is when the upstairs venue got packed, it got super muggy and hot. Combined with the muggy atmosphere and no ventilation whats so ever plus the smell of BO, cigarettes and weed- ew. It was so hard to stay the whole time.  They need to open a window or have some sort of air flow.  Also, we had VIP but random people kept coming into our space which was a nuisance to keep telling them to leave.  The bathrooms were located on the bottom level & two different bouncers kept telling us different spots to stand for the bathroom. It was a bit of an hassle to get access to the bathrooms.
author: Robin K.

description: I recently moved to SF and wanted to find a good local spot.  A friend of mine told me about Polk St. and somehow we ended up at Playland Bar.  It's a nice venue with a nice bar up front, a cool lounge on the first level, and a functional dance floor on the second level.
author: James H.

description: This is one of my favorite bars on Polk St for sure! I always come here first when bar hopping on Polk St. The drinks are priced well, the bartenders are nice and don't make you feel like they are about to have an anxiety attack if I don't order my drink faster, and also the music is pretty nice here Thurs-sat. One thing that sucks about this place is if you come after a certain hour they charge $5 cover at the door whether you are a female or not and also after you pay cover and go inside its like sardines in a can. But if you are partying in the Polk area I would definitely stop by and try this place out!
author: G O.

description:
NOT BAG FRIENDLY!!!!! I repeat, NOT BAG FRIENDLY!!!! I came here last Friday evening to enjoy some COCKtails while dancing my face off! PS (they were filming the Real World that night) eeeeekkkkk!! So I walk up to the front with my friend Stevie B and his roommate (she asked to stay anonymous) looking fly as could be, but were turned away. The bouncer looks at my brand new Versace Bag and says," sorry buddy, but we don't allow bags." Side note, this bag carries everything for me from my wallet to my female condoms. This place is trash! The only people that go to Playland are chubby 25 year olds grabbing a drink after sitting in their cubicle for 8 hours. Needless to say, I will not be returning! Unless they change to becoming a BAG FRIENDLY BAR! 

Sincerely, 
Dick Johnson (ASAP Fam)
author: Richard J.

description:
Went here on a Saturday at around 9:30-10pm. Free Cover(for me...not sure for guys). Downstairs is more chill than upstairs. Upstairs there's a dance floor with a pretty good DJ. The drinks were kinda small and weak(which is why this isn't 5 stars) but you can get a head buzz if you stay long enough. But all in all, this is a great place to START your night. It doesn't get crowded until about 11pm. The bouncers were really nice to me, but they were a little more strict with the guys. No harm to anyone tho :) 

I'd definitely come back. :)
author: Jessica K.

description:
This place is so much fun! Everyone in their 20's, super packed on weekends. It's a little on the small side, but there's an upstairs too, which helps a lot. There is only one bathroom for each gender, so you'll probably have to wait. The inside actually looks pretty nice with lots of neon lights everywhere.

The downstairs is more chill/loungey, while the upstairs has a dance floor. Both floors have their own bars. Some chairs/tables on both floors, but they are usually taken. The upstairs plays lots of EDM and Top 40 remixes.

The drinks are about $7, but a little small/weak, and beers are $5. No cover for girls, $5 cover for guys.
author: Cynthia W.

description:
I think I may have found my new go-to bar with a legitimate dance floor. Unlike many SF clubs, there are places to sit and chat, and unlike most SF bars, there is a big ol' bass-bumpin' dance-floor worthy of booty shaking. Get on your comfy cute clothes and head on over on a Saturday!

PROS:
- Top floor is mellow bar area/ top is the more fun dance floor
- Flat screens ft. music video of the song playing 
- 4 bar areas, wait for drinks isn't terribly long
- Groovy mix of 20-somethings, visiting from other countries or local

CONS:
- Drinks are somewhat weak
author: Stephanie T.

description: So happy playland has reopened. I didn't realize how much I had taken it for granted until I couldn't go there for a month. I love the fact that you can dance all night upstairs or choose just to post out and mingle downstairs. The employees are professional and the atmosphere is fun but not pretentious. The drinks are served up in a reasonable amount of time, even at peak hour. Finally, the remodel is great. It has always been a classy environment, but they really took it to the next level.
author: Yali C.

description:
Busted by the ABC for employee drug dealing, and trying to pass it off as "closed for remodeling". Not a good look.

http://sf.eater.com/2015/2/4/7982001/playland-bar-san-francisco-closed-suspended-cocaine-drugs
author: Boogee Z.

description:
It seems every pub crawl in town requires a stop through this top of Polk Gulch hotspot, so when St. Patrick's Day/Night (who can be certain?) came around, my crew and I clocked some hours on the dance floor. 

I was impressed with how well they handled crowd control by limiting access between the floors. Neither one seemed overcrowded (other than at the main bar on the second floor, but there's barely any room to walk there as it is) despite the Lepre-Con going on, and the DJ spun some remixed pop melodies. 

I could see this being a Saturday night go-to spot when I'm in the Gulch. If you haven't been yet, give it a whirl!
author: Kevin B.

description: Tried play land bar after my friend recommended it, every body is nice bar tenders and the security. The manager (Ruben) does his work really well and cares about hos customers, the place is two stories the 2nd floor more load for dancing and the 1st floor is good if you wanna geab a drink a cill.
author: Ghenwa S.

description:
Yet another fantastic night at Playland! Downstairs was chill, upstairs was POPPIN, and dranks were flowin.

Harry, you da best!!
author: Josie A.

description:
Classy style. Small front bar. Dance/lounge area. Poppy and dance music mostly.

Variety of high quality liquors and beers from around the world, but limited taps and liquor bar. Liquors on tap. Also really cheap happy hour deals. Beautiful tenders. 

Unique place with a little of everything. Fancier crowd for lower nob. They have hammered copper and black ostrich themed interior. 3 tables 12 tall chairs, 10 bar stools, up front. Black leather couch seating around the dance floor.
author: Brian L.

description: Loved all the drinks and the place was so much fun.. the music was also bomb!! Went on a Saturday night, so whoever the DJ is then, would highly recommend checking him out.
author: Jessica X.

description: I guess this review will be a bit skewed since I came here on NYE and everything is just ridiculous that day. This place is located on Polk which is cool because you can go bar hopping. I wasnt able to experience it but it was coo. Supposedly on a regular day, girls get in for free and guys would have to pay a bit but that night everyone paid. They jacked up the prices as the night continued so I had to pay $40 to get in which is ridiculous. Happy new year indeed. I do not believe there is a guestlist so just show up and get in line. The crowd is mostly white which is totally different than the asian club scene. What a contrast indeed. What I did like was the music. It is totally different than the Raven I am used to with the old school hip hop and pop. This place played current music like Dont Tell Em and the stuff you would hear on the radio. I have to come back on a regular night and update this review and experience the Polk. There are two floors and the dance floor is quite small but doable. I didnt see any seats where people without a table could chill though. Also, there is no coat check.
author: Amy H.

description:
Cover- $5 for guys
Beer- $5
Shots- $7
Really watered down drinks- $7

Its small alright place on Polk and it could be chill if it had less people or bigger but for insane prices and no room to move around on a Friday night, you're going to have to be drunk to have a good night.  Bartenders are nice, I actually didn't hate tipping them, but the jack & cokes were weak. Pregame before coming. This small place is cool but its trying to hard to be a club upstairs while keep the bar vibe downstairs. Its okay but if you're going to blow 50 bucks on a night with your friends there are probably better places in SF.
author: Jay N.

description:
Came here because a friend's friend was having a birthday and had gotten a table and bottle. If there was no bottle service set up I would NEVER have stepped foot in this place. 

Dance club/bar for college age kids that don't know any better. 

Bouncers seem like total d-bags, although I didn't really deal with them since we were on the list. Way too packed. No character. Shitty top 40 music. Horrible gross guys rubbing on drunkin stupid girls. 

So many awesome bars in SF will definitely never come back to this one.
author: Lina K.

description: I had lots of fun here! The bartenders were friendly and standard pours were generous and not too overpriced. The music was fun to dance to, playing a good mix of modern with songs from the early 2000s and even 90's. Also a good mix of people, everyone from finance bros, hipsters, foreign visitors and anyone in between. Mostly young, yes, but some older folks too. Bouncers were a little rude.  Boys and girls they do not find attractive will have the cover fee. Decent place.
author: Queen B.

description:
I would not recommend this place for ladies. This place is not safe for you! I went there with my girlfriend and we were rush to leave right away because this place is the one of the spots were shady guys go. It was crowded with dudes! And all the sucurity guards are dumb and they themselves have the hungry eyes looking around for drunk girls to take advante of!!!


Also, they were charging $5 from men and women are free, I guess they want more girls because the place is filled with dudes.
author: Oscar D.

description:
So, I had to survey Playland a little over time in order to determine how I really felt about it. My first experience- liked the music, appreciated the space, and thought the bartender was awesome. I had a cucumber martini here that is the second best I've ever tasted. When I mentioned to my friend how the numero uno still haunts me, the bartender slid over and topped off my bevvy with a little St. Germain to taste like the best cucumber martini ever made. I thought that was sweet. 

The second and third time I came, however, I was a little put off. Service has slipped. This last visit my friend and I waited quite a while for our drinks to be ordered, and I waited so long that I actually gave up and just sat down with friends to chat. The bartender was texting! And the bar-back was watching! To be fair, it may have been for business, but call me crazy, I love a good multitasking bartender/bar-back team. Then they were out of the beer my friend wanted, then they had no cold bottles of the second beer of request. Blah. 

The third time... I am sorry to say, but men were getting served with far more charm and attention, and while I believe that every bar has to have a shtick, I was put off by the clear play for tips from dudes while the ladies of the bar were treated like children interrupting adult conversation. C'mon, this place isn't run by amateurs, I've seen better service here! 

I'm not saying I've crossed them off the list forever, because there is something about that huge Spanish Bull on the wall that makes me dream of Pamplona, but I hope the service improves next time.
author: Kelly B.

description:
Do you know what it's like to have your heart broken into a million pieces? Me neither, because Playland provides me the recipe for forgetting everything: drinking, attentive bartenders, and loud music. 

Downside: Dude, where's my car?
Upside: Divas is around the corner. If you're into that stuff, of course. I always love watching the poor souls who don't know what they're getting themselves into.
author: Ben T.

description: Playland bar is one of my favorite bars to visit when I'm on Polk St. It appears small from the outside but when you walk in there are 3 rooms to go into, from the bar in the front, to the lounge in the back, and the dance floor upstairs! What a great atmosphere, plus everyone who works there is just fabulous.
author: Brittany P.

description: I am from the east coast traveling for work. Ali is the bomb bartender tinkering with the mescal drink and they have happy hour all night.  Great selection of tequila and vibes.  Will come back for sure.
author: Rodney G.

description: There's plenty of places on Polk Street to choose for a fun night out. So why should you choose Playland? It's got a dance floor upstairs with some bumping beats. It's got bars on both floors so you can get your alcohol fix pretty easily. Why shouldn't you choose Playland? Cover fee ($5) for what I consider a pretty unimpressive dance floor and a hefty idiot tax of 50%. That's right, if you have a good enough time that you end up forgetting to pick up your credit card, they charge you a 50% "tip". Definitely not a place to end the night.
author: Philip W.

description:
01.10.13 || bookmarked 07.08.12

Split level.  Upstairs is the lounge, sometimes with live music (and cover).  Downstairs feels more like a small sports bar.

So, it's got something for everyone.

I wish downstairs was slightly bigger, though.
author: Jenny L.

description:
I have to admit I noticed I had not been to this place when I saw it on the Real World. Now I know how trumped up that series is so I had to come check it out for myself. I have been to a ton of clubs and had somehow missed this one. 

I have to get this out of the way first. I don't know if it was just the night we went but I felt like I was in the Castro. I want this to be clear to guys and girls that go here. First there was a majority gay males there when we went like two out of every three guys. And I truly don't have any issue with it but guys that are looking for a club spot might want to know that this is the clientele it attracts. On the other hand women may also want to know this for a couple reasons. 

First if you are looking to NOT get grinded on. To enjoy of fun night of dancing with your girls. Dance around some flamboyantly awesome gay guys then you are going to love playland and to be honest I get why girls would want this for a little bit after going through the meat markets of Vertigo and Mayes. But its just not as fun. No one is really dancing with each other and it kind of turns into a crowded standing fest. 

Second if you ARE looking to get grinded on it didn't seem to be happening here. We left around midnight as it started to get packed and we saw several of the groups of women from playland at Mayes getting down later that night. 

And that kind of encapsulates this place. Its a safe fun starter night type establishment but if you want to have a real dance club experience you go somewhere else. Its good for a meeting up with four or five friends and some innocent dancing but don't we all want a little bit of regret in our night out? This is a little too safe and bland. 

I have to admit though. Maybe it was just the night we went but good god. The women were absolutely gorgeous. Like the best we have seen in this city. Probably they felt safer here than other establishments but as guys were felt like we have found the holy grail. It was glorious and then sad because they were stuck in this place. 

They charge a five dollar cover for guys which I am cool with I get it and then having to pay ten later to go to Mayes is a bummer but some might stick it out all night. The downstairs was a regular bar setup with fewer people. Upstairs is where the party is with a couple of bars and great bartenders. The floor was big enough to get a good number of people dancing without feeling too crowded like Vertigo but not as fun as Mayes' floor. 

The DJ was okay. If you are into EDM then this is your thing. A lot of mashups and safe music but no hip hop to be found. 

There were a lot of bouncers there for such a small space so you should feel safe and sound when you head into play land. 

Overall for a danceclub/bar this place is right in the middle. If this sounds like your clientele you are going to have a blast. If you are on the fence at all there are much better places to check out on Polk that will guarantee a good time. 

I must say so long to all the gorgeous women at Play land for I am sure I will ever see you all again if you only go here but it was a blessed sight while it lasted. Enjoy this oasis of non leering and ogling until guys read this review and show up in droves.
author: Nick R.

description:
While this place is fun, it will really only be fun if the attitude of the bouncers change. My friend got her phone stolen, out of her purse, while walking through the bar. It is clear the bouncers were in some way involved by their priceless reaction. Not to mention, multiple other people reported having their phone stolen the exact same night.  Then this article surfaced: http://sanfrancisco.cbslocal.com/2015/02/04/san-francisco-bars-liquor-license-suspended-after-employee-allegedly-caught-selling-cocaine-marijuana/. 

Sad unfortunate bouncers have to make GREAT, FUN bar some place I never want to return. 

Lastly, quite comical that they get their liquor license suspended and post on their website that they are "remodeling".
author: Katie J.

description:
WAY TOO PACKED. NOT COOL. WE LEFT AFTER 15 MINUTES. 

It was a chilly Saturday night in February and we were out and about on Polk celebrating my girlfriend's bday. Poor choice on our part. Sure, the line moved quickly and we got in, but once inside, it was an absolute nightmare.

PROS: not much. fast moving line?

CONS: 
- Only one dancefloor upstairs
- Dancefloor is small
- SUPER loud. We were shouting into each others eardrums. 
- No order to the madness.

Note to men: they charge $5 cover. 

Ladies get in FREE!
author: Sharon G.

description:
Not good for late 20s - early 30s. 

If you're under 24 years old, this place might be awesome, and even 24 might be a little old.  

I came here with a couple girlfriends on a Sat night. Although we had no trouble getting in (the line took about 7 min, and getting upstairs was free and easy)...once we got upstairs it was AWFUL...

Think sweaty sardine can, full of screaming 22 yearolds, and the most annoying top 40 tunes playing on a terrible sound system. 

Need I say more?! Wait I'll say one more thing, if you are late 20s - early 30s head elsewhere.
author: Monica G.

description: Great music, drinks and atmosphere !!! Security is awesome - modern & classy!
author: M D.

description:
Note: Keep in mind that this was my first actual bar experience. 

Downstairs is tiny but upstairs is much better with better music (it was a lot of EDM type when I went). Crowd was cool; seemed kind of hipster (fine by me). The bouncer and bartenders are nice (especially even after my friend got too drunk and made a mess). I liked that there was a lot of space for my friends and me to just hang around wherever. Drinks weren't bad. Don't know if this will make a difference for the whiskey lovers but apparently they don't carry Seagram's Seven Crown.

Verdict: I'll be back for more.

PS. It's true, the AC is really strong especially by the bar upstairs....
author: Jolene L.

description: This is my favorite place in the city to go grab a beer, great for someone trying to meet new people. The atmosphere specially in karaoke nights is awesome. Just be patient in line.
author: Armand A.

description:
I've been here a couple of times with colleagues.  Bartenders were very nice. I spilled a drink while drunkenly trying to have a conversation with a gentleman. The bartender  helped me clean up, poured another one, and didn't charge me.

There should be more bathrooms in this place. I've resulted to peeing in alleys a few times too many here. 

I lost my id and debit card here. That's how you know I had too much fun.

The time I went with friends was a lot more fun. I found myself dancing and singing to Justin Bieber and Miley Cyrus. Whatever. 

Ladies, no cover- that's always good.
author: Nicolle B.

description:
A place in SF to dance that I actually like?! It's about freaking time.

Came to Playland last Friday for a friend's birthday and had a great time. It got really crowded by the end of the night but that is bound to happen. Their wonderfully efficient ventilation system puts you in the middle of Chicago with high winds keeping the space nice and cool despite all the people.

Drinks were normally priced, nothing fancy but I sure wasn't trying to be fancy that night. There was an awesomely diverse and young crowd which made for a good time. It was also a breeze getting in and going in and out of the bar. When things got a little crowded, I ducked into a bar next door for a quick drink and then got right back in. 

Definitely recommend Playland!
author: Raina B.

description: Security is very courteous, the bartenders are friendly and the drinks are amazing! Love the vibe. Not too crowded but not dead. My girls and I will for sure be back!
author: Anastasia D.

description:
Really not a whole lot to say. Fun times all around. Upstairs/downstairs depending on your preference for chill vs. dance. Staff isn't the MOST friendly but they do a good job of crowd control, managing the dance floor, etc. 

Good crowd. Fairly balanced and diverse.
author: Ryan K.

description: This bar is very fun and I loved the atmosphere and local vibe. Really fantastic craft cocktails especially from bartender Yana. You might think it is small at first but there is an upstairs too so check that out as well.
author: Tara F.

description:
Oh man, I love Playland.  Happy hour Mondays are my favorite days. Well, followed by the eclectic mix Tuesday that is.  Or maybe bourbon cocktail Wednesdays. Hmm, have to make up my mind. Well, you get the point, I live right near by. 

To be honest, I was a bit skeptical when I first found out that Kimo's has changed ownership and no longer provides gritty entertainment that Polk street was famous for in its glory days. But like with everything else, times change and things change along with it.  

I love the new decor, friendly and beautiful stuff and let me tell you,  turns out dive bars don't have to be dark and smelly. When you there, make sure to check the second floor loft, one of my favorite changes to the space. With the views of the downtown traffic, it is a pleasure to sip the cocktail and look at the madness of the city from the high up. 

Just like I said at the beginning, it has become one of my favorite spots, but don't listen to me and come check it out for yourself
author: Misha K.

description:
I never came to this location when it was still Kimo's, and a few years later it's been transformed into this fun dance floor where apparently everyone I know goes to often.

On a given night, three different groups of friends went here separately, and I got to see them all. Awesome.

The upstairs is pretty packed but for good reason. The music is fun, people actually dance, and it's not impossible to get a drink and come back within a song or two.  drinks are very reasonably priced for an SF bar ($6 or $7 for well drinks).  Cover is free for girls, but boys had to pay $5.

The layout probably isn't the best, and the bathroom situation is awful, but overall this place is a good time and I am sure I will somehow end up there many more times in the future.
author: Naoko M.

description: We went here during the afternoon and it was a welcoming atmosphere. Clean place with good music playing. The bartender was very friendly and we were all exchanging laughs. The have bar games, which was fun, since it entertained us and everyone else at the bar. Good prices and specials too.
author: Jeffrey T.

description: I've always had a good time when I've come  here. Last time I was here I played beer pong in the back room. Today I'm celebrating the warriors championship.
author: Beni R.

description:
Playland has definitely become one of my go-to bars on Polk street and it seems that it's quickly becoming pretty popular. 

I honestly couldn't tell you what was there before Playland, but I think they have done a good job with the space. Both floors have tables and seating so it's a good spot to bring friends. However, it can get packed pretty quickly, especially on weekends.

The upstairs is great for dancing and they play good music (usually top 40, hip hop, mashups, and dance). It does get packed pretty quickly and they charge cover for guys, ladies are free ;) It also gets pretty hot up there and there aren't any other fans except for one right in the middle of the dance floor (you'll find me there! who wants to be sweaty in a bar? NOT cute!)

The drinks are decently priced - I ordered a Greyhound, which ran be about $9. It's not the cheapest place on Polk but they make a good drink.

The crowd is pretty mixed - I'd say late 20's to early 30's. More of the Marina type crowd, at least from what I could tell. 

Definitely a solid spot on Polk for bar-hopping but I wouldn't stay there all night.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Love the strawberry basil martini.  They have pretty good service and I like that there's no cover for their dancefloor.

BIG CON: 1 bathroom for each gender.. really?!  You've got 2 floors packed with people and only 1 bathroom? The girls line was ridiculously long and it just snaked around to the bar, causing major blockage to the hallway.  Isn't there some type of regulation about capacity and # of bathrooms offered?
author: Michelle W.

description: Playland tries to cater to a wide range of customers. They have different events throughout the week, such as karaoke on Tuesdays, club nights on Friday and Saturday, as well as Salsa dancing on Sunday. The bar staff is friendly and professional. Drink prices are reasonable with the Polk street area. I recommend the Mezcalita, a smoky cocktail made with Vida mezcal. My only criticism is it can get very crowded upstairs, but could definitely be enjoyable if you like to dance and listen to music.
author: Joey A.

description:
I liked the vibe and the layout of this place. You enter on the ground floor and are greeted by a traditional long bar with trendy, dark-ish decor. But in my opinion, the real fun is upstairs. That's where the DJ is jamming to a great mix of "current" pop/top 40/EDM and a few throwbacks as well :) The dance floor is on the small side, but that also makes it less daunting when you actually have to cross it to, you know, order a drink. I also appreciated the seating available around the dance floor if you're in the mood to just chill, sip your drink, and people-watch.

best part: $7 shots. I literally did a double-take when the girl told me that my bill was only $14 for two shots haha
author: Leslie C.

description: On Friday, it's free for women but $5 for guys for the upstairs portion, which was extremely crowded.  The dance floor is a joke and the low ceilings on the second floor makes this place kinda claustrophobic. It doesn't get that stuffy since they have an obnoxious ceiling fan by the bar may blow your hair all in your face since it's powerful.  They cram so many people in here, it doesn't make it conducive to hang out in a larger group.  It was a diverse crowd in age and race.  Bartenders were efficient and nice.
author: Chris L.

description:
Hell.  On.  Earth.

Basically an oil-packed tuna can full of "yolo" girls and guys who wear polos.
Bartender couldn't be slower.  While you're at it, please add alcohol to my drink.
Some guys punched my friend in the boobs, almost a legitimate scuffle.
I had a Ludacris moment and just had to scream "MOVE BITCH."  I really did.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
It's like every frat boy ever decided to come to Playland instead of containing their testosterone within the confines of their frat house. Insufferable. It doesn't help that Playland packs you all in like a herd of cattle. 

"Move along, now," I said to some steroided fratty who stopped the entire flow of cattle traffic to tell his bro that, like, Tina's not acting very cool tonight, bro.

"Relax!" he snarled at me, then straight-up punched me in the tits, knocking the wind out of me.

"Oh, yeah, being punched in the chest is totally going to make me relax!" I said, and since he decided things were ready to get physical, I pushed him aside so the throngs of innocent cattle could continue their pilgrimage to the overcrowded bar.

Recommended if you like listening to the same songs that were played at your junior prom in 2004, bringing the Marina to Polk Street, being crushed in a throng of people, and not drinking alcohol. Otherwise, just go have a better time at Hemlock.
author: Jessie H.

description: My favorite spot on Polk St. They have live music during the week which is awesome and it's a great venue to go to on the weekend for drinks and dancing. The upstairs has large windows that overlook Polk and a bar so you don't have to go back downstairs on a crowded weekend night. The staff is always friendly, courteous and attentive. They consistently make wonderful cocktails and have good beers on tap - And the recently remodeled the spot! Very nice!!
author: Forrest C.

description: Playland is my go-to bar for a good drink. My favorite is Apricot Diplomat - try it! The downstairs and small and intimate, a perfect place to catch a game or grab a drink after work. Great  ambiance, friendly patrons, top notch bartenders and amazing music. If you feel like hitting the dance floor, the upstairs always has a good crowd, its well ventilated and the music is fun.
author: Yelena K.
