description: Uhhhhhhhhhhhhh.. what a swordfest.  Came here Saturday night (per my co-workers suggestion) and this place was packed (were talking like a sardine can) with dudes.   There were a few chicks, but yikes, definitely not my scene.  We waited 30 minutes to get in and even didn't mind paying the $5 cover to get up stairs but holy moses this place is packed, no matter if your up stairs or down stairs.  The drinks were stiff, but it took a while to get a drink.  I did like the view from the 2nd floor out to the streets, other than that, I wasn't impressed.  I'll stick to the marina!
author: Mike M.

description: I really like the split levels idea. The ground floor gives you an opportunity to be in a dive bar while the second floor has a dance floor and gives you a feeling of a night club  . I have been there 3 times and always had a blast - 5 star for that
author: George B.

description: Playland is an awesome bar. I've been here a few times since it recently opened. The bar is nicely located on the corner of Polk and Pine streets and is close to many restaurants. Good service. Couldn't be happier.
author: Frances V.

description: Came here last Saturday night, went in after 11:30 and the upstairs club was super super packed!! It was hard to dance since people were bumping up on you all the time.  The crowd was good looking which is something I always like when I go out, very young crowd unfortunately it was a lot of annoying 21 year old girls who probably were on their first night clubbing.  Music was Pop Top40, not my thing since I feel like I can just turn up the radio and dance  to it anytime I want to. But overall I liked this place and it was fun.  I still prefer much more House EDM clubs
author: Francisco B.

description:
The owners of Playland put a lot of work into this space. But that goes to show that one can put a lot of work and end up with just an average place. The drinks are fine, the prices are not unreasonable, and the space is pretty nice. The other patrons, well, your mileage may very.

[Kimo's used to be here]
author: Suo L.

description:
Visited the bar on Zombie night and had fun time.  Half of the upstairs bar/dance floor were all dressed up.  Drinks weren't exorbitantly expensive, and the dj played top 40 forty music and popular mesh-ups.

Pros: Fun, no cover if you come early, sexy bartenders, great AC unit to cool you down on the dance floor

Cons: Gets crowded quickly and people start shoving you aside as the night wears on
author: Yorick J.

description: This is my first Yelp review ever but I felt I had to because I was upset with this place. I went on a Friday night with a big group of friends. Let me start off by sayin I'm no thug, or lowlife, I'm an upstanding citizen and when I got out I spend money at whatever establishment I go to. When we approached Playland Bar the doorman said I couldn't come in because of the dress code. I was wearing black pants a nice shirt and Timberlands. I looked inside and most people were in jeans and t shirts so I asked what he meant and he said my shoes weren't allowed it. Again I looked inside and most of the patrons were wearing tennis shoes, slip on vans, I even saw one guy in there with smiles face emojis all over his shoes. Not in a rude way, I went up o the door man, who by the way was wearing black and red Jordans (which he looked too old to be wearing anyway) and I asked him "vans are allowed but not Timbs?" To which he Rudely and confrontationally said "are you wearing Timbs? They obviously we don't allow Timbs". I don't want to sound like a snob, but I could have bought 5 pairs of Vans for the price my Timbs were. The door guy had a weird power trip over a bar and I took my business elsewhere. Too to anyone that has a similar encounter walk down to Vertigo. No dick on a power trip at the door and good music. I spent a lot of money there and because I was treated better
author: Armando M.

description:
Unless I'm truly blown back in my seat I never like to 5-star a joint on my first visit so I would usually go with four until I've seen it on 3 or 4 different nights of the week. I'm going to make an exception because this spot is new and they need the publicity - plus the owners did a first-rate remodel.

I'll start by saying this is definitely *not* the old Kimo's. Playland is its own experience and stands up nicely along side the other swanky ambiance bars on the Polk Gulch stretch (Lush Lounge, Royal Oak, Amelie, Zeki's). It is a split level bar, though the upstairs does't open until May 10th.

Playland is named after the old Ocean Beach amusement park ( http://goo.gl/lm4NP ) and will have loads of fun theme decorations when the owners finish it up.

Where a bar like Eve is trying very hard to convey a Victorian/Gothic feel, or to be a high end Harlot, Playland succeeds at an elegant down-tempo sort of Steampunk. Rosewood, copper accents, and wall to wall dark paneling (large rivets) give an Edison/Tesla sort of feel to the place, complete with vacuum tube lighting in the alcoves behind the liquor shelves.

My drink was well mixed, if a bit on the pricey side at around $8.60 for a Mandarin Cranberry (they only had Ketel Orange). The bar & door staff was friendly and the light Sunday evening crowd was diverse, as you might expect on an off-night in this part of town. I had a great chat about the changing neighborhood with a tattooed Mexican guy with a bright smile. I noted the standard Polk street crowd in the center of the bar, and a guy working on his laptop at a table by the window.

I stopped by Playland for two reasons. For one, my brother's SEO Firm (Kickstart Search) had been contacted to do a very basic website for them so I was curious what kind of a venue they had put together. The other is that I was waiting on a large pizza at Victor's, half a block away, and had a puppy with me. I was looking in from outside, checking out the spot, and the bartender waved me in saying my small dog was ok.

Check, immediate star for a dog friendly bar.

They also have two gorgeous LED TVs in high definition at the downstairs bar and will have more upstairs. It looks like a great game spot.

Only time will tell what Playland becomes. They will be opening the upstairs this week, at which point the layout should feel like a smaller version of Raven Bar (1151 Folsom). As a result, this will be yet another venue packed to the gills with 20-somethings on Thursday, Friday and Saturday night. If that isn't your scene, then you probably aren't on Polk those nights anyhow.

The Bush & Polk Garage ($2/hr - closes at 10 on week nights, 2 on Fri/Sat, closed Sunday) is your closest workable parking location. Just be very aware of the hours of operation.

As for the rest of the week, if you don't mind the higher-end drink prices and feel like an alternative to the nearby Lush Lounge, Playland is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood.

--

Update: having toured the upstairs I now know that the a/v system is stellar. The floor to ceiling windows offer a beautiful view of the bustle on Polk street and it should be a particularly nice vantage point right around sunset. The stage area includes two 60" LED televisions and the bar has several beers on tap from keg lines downstairs. There's really nothing else like this North of Market and the owners are making a real effort to avoid having it fall into a top-40 niche upstairs. They are even booking a burlesque accordion band to play there.

Again, it takes time for a venue to develop a personality (the reviewer behind me had a nice time trolling the clientele before the Grand Opening even occurred) but the ingredients are there for Playland to develop a fun one.

As for a hands-on approach, this was the first time I was personally contacted by a venue owner to thank me for the level of detail in a review. Say what you will about the style of the decor and the future band choices but the owners are a real class act.
author: Ian A.

description:
I really love the decor at the place. Its got a nice modern classy decor and is really clean, maybe cause its relatively new. I've only been here during the early evening so I have no idea what the late evening scene is but I really enjoyed getting drinks here. They've also got a couple tv's to watch whatever sports games are happening at the moment.

The service is great and the staff friendly. They've also got a limited but well edited selection of beers both on tap and by the bottle and the prices are quite good for a Polk street bar. I'll definitely hit this place up again when I'm in the neighborhood for a quick drink with some buddies.
author: Will S.

description:
It doesn't seem like a dive bar but it acts like one.
The bartenders are nice and generous but aren't creative.
The clientele is average but not responsible and yet interesting the type you think about sleeping with but recall you've been drinking and then slip  and slide away.

It's cool but will be cooler when the stage for bands opens.

Polk Street is full of bars now and this one at this point is just average despite the cuteness of the bartender.
author: Alexander R.

description: My favorite bar by far! The owners are super nice ! The bartenders are very attentive and attractive ! It does get a bit crowded but that's only because it's the place to be at on a Friday night ! Overall, I always have a great time there ! I definitely recommend checking it out :)
author: Hazel A.

description: This is a great bar on Polk for a night out with friends. Has a bar right at the entrance where you can sit and chat, a room that is more private with large leather couches and a small bar, and a medium sized dance area on the second floor with a full bar.
author: Joao P.

description: Great craft cocktails and happy hour.. Nightclub upstairs is fun for dancing and good music
author: Shaughni N.

description: It was hoppin at midnight. Lots of handsome guys and gorgeous bartenders. Great place to play
author: Claire M.

description:
I rarely hop out to polk to go bar hopping but all the spots here are chill. Just a block away from another bar, playland is one of the nicer spots you can hit up. 

They have a full sports bar with big screen tv's and a spacious upstairs that play top-40 for all those rachets. 

their drinks are REALLY STIFF. screwdriver? pineapple vodka? oh man hella stiff. Unless you ask for a premium vodka, they will drown that cup with alcohol and it will get you goon wasted. 

Staff here is awesome. Bouncer = awesome. Bathrooms = thumbs down. always a huge line for that damn bathroom
author: Kenny L.

description: I went here on 12-23-14 9:30pm'sh.  My friend told me to go to this bar for karaoke, Amanda throwing the gig.  I had their lagunitas ipa, corona, lager?(forgot the name), and bought a heinenken for my friend,  all for $5 each, gingerale $2. Upstairs is roomy with good sound system.  There was a pub crawl, hence certain times this bar was packed.  Two unisex restrooms were located downstairs (I wish they would replenish the paper towels or get electric dryers). I asked the bartender how much was hard liquor, he said $10 for the Patron (noticed it was on tap) and Hennessey shots, $8 jameson, I ordered this one ipa(but I think it was contaminated, he was cool and gave me a stella on tap). Overall I do like this bar.
author: Jer W.

description: I feel my review might be slightly slated, as this was the last stop on our Halloween bar crawl. We paid 15 fro a wrist band to get us 3 dollar drink specials at 6 or more different bars. The place was totally packed, we couldnt even barely walk in. We made our way though. I even found my self a stool so i would have to be a sardine amongst the people. I remember a few details, first the drinks were fresh and delicious. I also remeber the bartenders being really super sweet.
author: Desiree Y.

description:
Literally a hop away from my go-to Grub Steak, Playland offers me a very inviting and comfortable hang out to either sit and read, watch a game, or hang out with buddies.

On a recent visit I had the opportunity to visit and while there hang out with the bartender, Julia. What a spark of sunshine she adds to the place. Not only does she expertly mix concoctions, she is by far one of the most engaging hosts I have had the opportunity to meet.  

Perhaps the hint of Eastern European charm, her naturally good looks, inviting personality, and most of all, attention to customers, makes her an absolute delight to hang out with. 

I'll be back for sure. To the management of Playland: a touch of genius adding Julia to the mix, no pun intended! 

Rock on Playland!
author: Doc P.

description: Fun fun wanna come back soon and bring my girls. I didnt have a problem with anything besides the dancefloor they make the back a vip but its still connected to the dancefloor with a belt that separates it kinda weak because it gets crowded and everybody ends up back  there any ways and security is tryna regulate. But any ways I had a good time and everytime I go here someones always.buying me drink since people forget that theres a 20 dollar limit on the card so catch a dumb dumb at the bar hahaha. Gonna be coming back soon so catch me in motion
author: Gracelove C.

description: There were 20 minutes left for the pub to close (at 1:40 AM on a Saturday night). We were there to celebrate a birthday and it was extremely rude for the waiter to snatch the drink from the birthday girl and 4 other friends and ask us to get out 20 min before the bar closing time. We were quietly sitting at a table on level 1. Horrible experience!! Will never go back and hope the place closes down soon.
author: Ketan K.

description: If you are thinking of a fabulous venue to host your next event I highly suggest Playland Bar! My friend hosted her fashion show here and what an incredible evening.... the atmosphere and the staff are spot on! I really love what they have done with this space, the theme and decor are whimsical and fun. My friend is having her baby shower here in January. I helped make arrangements and really want to give huge kudos to the manager Reuben for making setting this up so easy breezy!! Can't wait to indulge in strawberry basil martinis and play here soon! ~Cheers
author: Jennifer H.

description: This bar is definitely for a certain type of scenester. If you're looking for a dance club (rarity in SF) that is packed to the gills and walking through a schweaty mess -- this place is for you. It's a fun place to stop by at the end of the night if you're already in the zone. But if you're looking to get in the zone by coming here... you're probably better off going elsewhere.
author: Mel G.

description: Good cocktail but with a surly bartender....absolutely atrocious music. Justin Beiber??? Seriously??? No me gusta.   I will not be back to play.  Polk is filled with good bars....keep walking.
author: Darby W.

description:
I went to this bar back in the day when it was Kimos. Kimos had a lot of rich history, but it was looking kinda of washed up more recently.

I went there on the opening day of the new Playland. My friend and I went in for an afternoon drink to settle our nerves. We weren't expecting much, but the decor improved drastically and the outfits the bartenders were very cute.

Next thing you know, the bartender says, "This gentleman is buying everyone in the bar a round of drinks!"

Woohoo. I can't complain about another Lagunitas. 

I talked to the gentleman, and apparently, we was a beer Anheuser-Busch distributer. We chatted for a bit and he was so impressed that I was drinking Lagunitas IPA. We were speaking about the many breweries in the bay.

He asks, "Ready for another round?" And he buys another round for everyone in the bar again.

Although he was a distributer, he was still buying a ton of mixed drinks, etc. that weren't what he was selling. 

He must have felt like the man when he left. We all cheered and applauded his exit.

Everyone was really friendly. I talked to the bartender Jessica, a sound engineer, and a promoter on top of the distributer. 

Maybe because it was a new kegerator, but damn, those IPAs caught up so quickly and I wasn't able to drink after the three.

I'm definitely going back. Hopefully someone pulls the same behavior!
author: Patty C.

description: Yana is amazing. You should come here and experience her. Ruben give this girl a raise! Yana I coming back, you're the best bartender I've ever seen at this place!
author: Sara Jo R.

description: If I could leave zero stars, I would. Do NOT go to this place if you have a nice smart phone you want to keep. I came here with a few friends after being up at Wreck Room for a friend's graduation party and my brand new iPhone 6s got stolen right out of my purse. Mind you, this is the SECOND time this has happened to me on almost two years and I've known 3 other people who have had the same thing happen to them. My purse was zipped and cross bodied and it was so insanely packed upstairs that you couldn't even notice that someone was stealing something right off your person. DO NOT GO HERE. These people need to fix how and who they let in to this bar. The music was mediocre, the drinks are watered down and too expensive & your stuff gets jacked. There's plenty of other places to go where you won't get things stolen or sweat on.
author: Jill M.

description:
Such an upgrade from Kimo's!  A ground-up renovation has completely changed my perspective on this place. The two level concept with different ambiances is a genius idea.  Have a drink and a conversation with friends on the first floor, or go upstairs for some dancing.  The ventilation system was reconfigured to blow cool air directly on the dance floor and throughout the second level.  The floor to ceiling windows provide a loft feeling and strong drinks will enhance your mood. 

It gets crowded on Friday and Saturday nights after 11pm.  Happy hour is all night long on Mondays.  Two large TVs over the lower bar create a great spot to watch a game.

Overall, one of my new favorites in the area!
author: Vadim N.

description: One of the top bars in the Pulp Gulch.  Fun atmosphere with a rowdy, yet reserved crowd that doesn't get out of hand.  Karaoke on Tuesday is a blast, and bonus points for the bartender Cameron for always serving up delicious original cocktails.
author: Joe S.

description: I've been to this bar a number of times and the experience varies on the time of day you go and who serves you.  If you're looking for a speak easy type of bar, it's there for you during the week or during the weekend in the day. If you're looking for a club style environment with gorgeous girls, -and I'm from Miami so I'm critical on this factor, you can find it on friday and Saturday night.  Cocktails are good and there are a multitude of affable Bar tenders with some talent. They're all attractive people from different countries (once again I'm from Miami so this is important to us).  But there are a few that stand out. Inna, Fernanda and Julia are probably the most attractive capable Bar tenders of the group. Cameron is the only guy guy but probably one of the more knowledgeable mixologist that I've met.
author: Frank P.

description:
Extremely busy on the usual nights, to the extent that it's difficult to navigate the downstairs, which is cramped enough when empty.

Upstairs is less cramped, has the usual deafening music, but is slightly less cramped and even has a reasonable size dance floor.

No cover before late evening, but don't make the mistake of going downstairs then back up across the change of hour, because you'll get charged a cover. If you're male. You'll notice everyone here saying there's no cover is female.

Yes, Playland is illegally (Unruh) collecting a discriminatory cover charge for men only. I went in with a group of 10 women and I'm the only one charged $5. I guess that's what not being white and male must feel like to everyone else :) Quite educational.

As obnoxious as any other loud bar-kinda-club setup anywhere else, but with the advantage of not being in the middle of nowhere like most of the others.
author: John R.

description: The feel is a little bit snooty with a huge sash of hipster. I like the drinks a lot. It's strong and tasty giving you yhat nice warm buzz you need to get you out the door to walk to the next place. I'd bring friends here to catch up with them, over drinks of course.
author: Christina L.

description:
A friend of mine rented out the room in the back behind the bar downstairs for Halloween. Its the perfect size for about 40 people on a flow. Its right by the bathrooms, and you are able to do bottle service which worked out great for our group. The room itself is perfect for a party. It has a tv as well, so if you had a sports game you want to watch maybe they can play it on there? They had a movie on when we were there. 

My only complaints - it was hotter than hades in the back room - like sweating through our costumes hot. Do they not have air conditioning? The back room has no windows so that didn't help. Also the bathroom is shared, like for everyone downstairs, which is crazy!

Lastly, we went upstairs to dance for a bit and it was so incredibly crowded you could barely get to the dance floor.  Maybe they should let in a few less people? They played top 40s music which is fine.
author: Natalie N.

description:
25 seat/stool bar in Russian Hill...

Apparently no bar food...

2 tv's to watch games on tv...

The "plus"...Monday nights have 5 buck Jameson and Fernet after 9pm. Very worthwhile if those are any of your poisons! "Industry night...lol"

Nice blend of 80's music spinning loudly from the speakers...

Nice staff. Stiff drinks. Not bad for a nice decored hole in the wall...will be back after 9pm again!
author: Kyu L.

description: Came here last night and had a great time. The dance floor was packed and so hot but the music was great and kept us dancing for hours. If you want to avoid the creepy club scene but still want to dance, Playland is the perfect choice.
author: Sinead T.

description: Playland Bar is AWESOME!! They have it all! It's a great club on the weekend with live DJ's who play something for everyone and it's also a really chill spot to have a drink on a mellow night. Last Sunday afternoon was particularly cool because I got to watch the Giants game, have a great cocktail, and there were a bunch of people dancing and enjoying the long weekend. The bartender was friendly and fun and knew how to keep the place feeling as good as he was. I can't wait to come back here and enjoy this real, down home San Francisco establishment. Great job Playland!!
author: Mark U.

description: Came here on a Friday night and was pick pocketed for my iPhone while walking through the crowd upstairs. Went downstairs, which was fairly empty and the same thing happened to another girl. I guess this happens a lot and is a recurring theme at this bar specifically so just wanted to warn people!
author: Shaina T.

description: Great neighborhood vibe, low key (at least on the 1st floor, we didn't go upstairs). Cocktail menu is solid and the people are friendly.
author: Amber M.

description:
Came here on the Sunday before Labor Day to grab some drinks, but we didn't stay long.  Downstairs was pretty small with only a few tables and very cramped standing room, so luckily we got a table.  I'm told upstairs was a dance floor, but apparently there was some sort of event going on and they were charging cover to go upstairs that day.  
Pretty meh experience, but maybe if the upstairs area was open it would've been a lot more fun.
author: Keith C.

description:
I've been here a few times, usually following the plans of friends. It's always usually an alright time. The downstairs area feels like a psuedo loungy type bar, with some tvs playing sports. Upstairs is usually where I hang and they have another bar, some seating and then a smallish dance floor.

Drinks aren't too expensive. DJ is pretty good, plays a mix of house/hip-hop. Towards peak hours (12-1) it gets super packed and you often have to physically push people out of the way... There's also usually a moderate line at this time too. They also recently started charging $5 to go upstairs, however this seems to be only for guys and after a certain time. I guess they're trying to level out the gender ratios.

Overall, I usually have an alright time here. I like the dancing. I think my main beef with the place though is the clientele. It's a bit "bro"-ish, however I guess that's just the area. I'm sure I'll be back though...
author: Mike C.

description:
Loved my first Polk Street experience at Playland! 

Ambiance: I was a bit worried when I saw that the bottom floor was so small and crowded, but luckily as we walked up the stairs, we were welcomed with a much larger floor with a nice dance floor and another big bar. The ambiance of the bar was great! Kind of dark, interesting and fun mix of people, and fantastic music. Literally the only downside was this super awkward air that was blowing in our faces at different areas. When you get to a bar, you really shouldn't be COLD. But I guess it makes sense because every time we took a break from dancing, the air felt really nice. But the air should be on the dance floor...definitely not right next to the bar where people are talking and hanging out (and thus, probably not dancing/hot). Buttt sorry for that digression, amazing ambiance! Just crowded enough to not make you want to kill yourself but not so deserted that you think you're at the wrong place. 

Drinks: Decently priced and really sweet bartenders! There is a $20 minimum for credit cards though, so watch out if you don't have cash. Also I asked the lady to make my $17 total for two drinks into $20 to let me use my credit card...and she made it $20.89. Kind of annoying because I didn't ask her to make it higher than $20 but it's okay I was having a really good night :) 

Bottle Service: A friend of a friend's got our group bottle service and it was amazing! We got the area in the front of the dance floor with couches, and enjoyed our night with handles of Grey Goose, orange juice and cranberry juice and tons of dancing :) Definitely pricey, but also easily made our night infinitely more enjoyable (and less crowded). 

Verdict: GO GO GO! It's also around a ton of other bars so a perfect place to bar hop and there's also good food in the area open super late (Bob's donuts or Mel's Diner, both good options) so it's a great place to be at night! Also no cover (not sure if this is only for girls) but yay! And the bouncers are all super nice, so you don't feel at all annoyed or weirded out.
author: Anu P.

description:
Playland is great! its such a nice new addition to the Polk St. collection of bars.

its super clean, and the crowds are fun.  the bartender Jessica was super nice and and wonderfully responsive.

i def recommend this bar and day of the week!
author: Elliott A.

description: Bartender until 9 pm made the experience positive. But what a change when the new bartender arrived. She was more into socializing than taking care of customers.
author: Judi G.

description:
This seems to be the new trendy/hip place on Polk Street. 

I went on Friday after work for TGIF Happy Hour with friends. Downstairs is small and great for individual or smaller gathering (that is if you can snag a table) but we needed a bigger setting so we went upstairs and was able to have our own designated area with great upbeat music, courteous bartender, and scenic view overlooking Polk Street. There is a good selection of cocktail choices and I found my favorite..the Strawberry Basil Martini! A phenomenal cocktail ..very tasty and goes down smooth. We stayed longer when the place becomes party central after 10:30 pm. This is when everyone awakes from their nap after work or had their dinner and is now ready to party and burn off their calories! You won't be sitting at all since the DJ mixes all your favorite music from top 40/Hip Hop to Old School. Overall, this playground is definitely a great looking place. It's a more intimate feeling than other clubs downtown or SOMA. 

I highly recommend this place for happy hour, cocktails, and dancing. An improvement over the old dingy Kimo's. 

To the party people

Pros:
1) Great place to drink, talk, flirt, and be in pleasant company with friends and strangers
2) Good crowd control, still packed but not to the point where it's unbearable
3) No cover charge!

Cons:
None - negativity gives negative outcomes to oneself

They also have clear plasma TVs for sports and hope they have special gatherings for Super Bowl, World Series, Summer Olympics, and PPV boxing. Go Giants!
author: Vagabond C.

description: Worst bartender I've met yet! There were 3 off us in there on a Sunday afternoon drinking and watching the game. Two out-of-town floozy's walk in with their idiot guys and request music. The bartender has the nerve to shut the Giants game down and turn on hiphop so these girls can bounce around. I couldnt leave quick enough and was saved by a neighbor bar with real SF people
author: Heather W.

description: My favorite bar in the city.  It's just a very fun place with cool decor, top-notch bartenders, and awesome reasonably priced drinks!  I love that there are so many different parts of this place with different feels.  The downstairs bar is great for having conversations with friends, the backroom has couches and more of a "lounge" feel, and the upstairs has the dance floor with more of a "club" type atmosphere.  There's something here for everyone.
author: Chester S.

description: Dave and the group which hosts the band upstairs are great. Ask him about the open mike and if you can jam. They're a great group and good folks. Good jazz, r&b, and r&r. You'll like it.
author: Paul W.

description: The music was good. It was wayyyy too crowded and hot. They let too many people in. Be careful because when I went a bunch of people had their phones and wallets stolen off of them because it was so crowded. The security was not helpful at all. I am never going back.
author: Amanda T.

description: Fun place, reasonably priced. Bottom floor gets uncomfortably packed but second floor (while still crowded) feels less claustrophobic; you may have to wait in a short line to go up.  You even have a chance finding a place to sit up there which can be nice
author: Ross I.

description:
Nothing special, just a standard bar on Polk. On weekends at night they try to make it clubby, with DJs and music. It was so packed when we went on a weekend night that our entire group didn't stay longer than 5 minutes. It was a nightmare and the music wasn't good. Drinks are mehhh. But what can you expect when they pack the place. 

If you are looking to get sloppy than you probably would enjoy this place.... Me, not so much.
author: Brittany S.

description: I was expecting more of a playground theme from this place...  Guess that's my fault.  We did get a bar fight, though!  I think this place might be better on like a Tuesday.  There were a LOT of people and not really much space to move around.  Or stand stationary.  Clubs are really not even my thing, so maybe take this review with a grain of salt.
author: Nora S.

description: I went here for the first time this past weekend and I loved it! The dance floor on the second floor is where it's at! It got crowded but the people weren't pricks and everyone was having a good time. The DJ was great and kept the music going with lots of energy and popular tracks. I do think it's a bit silly that if you go downstairs to use the restroom that you have to wait in a line to go back upstairs but I suppose that's just their means of crowd control. All in all, a fun place where I will definitely be back.
author: Brittany L.

description: I've only been here to consume beverages.  In my opinion, this is one of the best places to go out on Polk.  It's very versatile - you can be downstairs at the bar in the entrance and have a lot of space and talk, or you can be upstairs listening to loud 90's music and dancing.  Last weekend, I did the
author: Andrew H.

description: I've been to several private events at the upstairs bar and they always do a great job. The owners and bar manager are helpful in accomodating and the drinks are delicious- especially the strawberry basil cocktail. The bartenders are all professional and foxy (yeah, I'm superficial in this regard), and pleasant. I brought my nephew here for his 21st birthday and everyone in the bar made sure he was having a good time. The only down side is that it does get crowded later at night (the price of success) so I tend to get here early so I can enjoy it when it's still pretty chill.
author: Mishka L.

description: First time here last night.  Had so much fun! Definitely gonna go back! The place wasnt hella upscale but the prices were good and drinks were great!
author: Ektomi D.

description: Went here on a busy pre-Halloween weekend and had a great time. Friendly staff, fun crowd and pretty good service (it was a packed house--so you can't expect prompt drinks). I'd definitely come back again for some dancing and good times!
author: Althea D.

description: This is a great bar. Depending on your mood, you can get the best of both worlds. Go upstairs and enjoy drinks and dancing with your friends. If you're in a more calm mood, hang out downstairs and enjoy the drinks while watching a game. The location is great. This is likely the best bar/lounge on Polk street. And the bartenders take care of you - especially with their creativity when you're not sure what you want.
author: Cëma M.

description: It's ok. They almost charged my credit card too much until I brought it to their attention. At least they fixed it (I checked my account) Fun place though as a stop on a bar hop adventure on Polk street LOL
author: Vol T.

description: Everyone has to be careful!!!!!! Someone stole my phone in the playland. This is not a safe place. The guards and bartender have no idea how to do this.
author: Minmindy W.

description:
Went here last night around 9 and went upstairs to dance. It was completely dead so being 3 of 5 people up there we sat down on the couch area with a small dinky table. Place started to fill up and around 11 this douchey tool that must have been dealing with the bottle service area came over to my friends and I and was completely rude to us and told us we need to move the table is reserved, and we happened to be sitting there the last two hours. I asked him where the sign was and he said someone must have taken it because he put it out at 8 when he got there. Funny bc we had been there since 9 and upstairs was empty I guess one of the other two people up there must have removed all the signs for the tables. I called him out on his lies and he was just so rude to us. He then proceeded to tell me I can take my business elsewhere if I am unhappy. So we did, we left immediately. The area didn't even look like a bottle service seating area it looked like a free for all seating. I'm sorry but play land is nothing special where you need a bottle service area it's a joke.Someone needs to teach this fool how to properly ask people to move, don't lie about it and don't be a dick.


So two stars because upstairs played good music and AC was on full blast upstairs which was nice when it started to get crowded and all the body heat.
author: Krista R.

description: It can get hot and stuffy in here. The bartenders make great drinks though. I once came for happy hour on a weekday and decided to go to the back room to sit down and have my drink, but the place was filled with fruit flies.
author: Linda N.

description:
The snobs invade mid-Polk 

Take a bunch of snobby, shallow 20-something white kids from Pac Heights and put them in a bar that could be in any urban setting.

Although the owners spend some cash on making the place "upscale", it misses the mark because it doesn't feel authentically San Francisco. A quick walk in here and you could be in downtown Denver, Phoenix, or any other generic U.S. city. Why? Because the overly dressed snobs pose and gawk at people (even laughing at people) as they sip on silly cocktails in a futile attempt to look cool. 

Plenty of fake blonds and attitude here if that's your thing.

NO THANKS!
author: Ted K.

description: If you're enjoying a night on Polk Street this is a good place to start your night at. It gets really packed as the night goes on- hence why it is a good place to start. I came with a friend on a Saturday; we had no problem walking right in. The downstairs is smaller, we didn't really get to experience it since we went straight upstairs. The bartenders really know what they're doing. I don't know what she made us but it was delicious! The upstairs has a smaller bar, plenty of seating, a dance floor and VIP area. They do regulate how many people they let upstairs once the crowd rolls in so beware of going back and forth. I can't say whether they charge a cover but do note there is only ONE UNISEX BATHROOM.
author: Clarissa L.

description:
I thought it was worth taking the time to give Playland a review. In SF, everyone is always looking for a new place to hang out and Playland is definitely one of these places. It also has the potential to turn into the "usual" hang out spot. I like the vibe it gives off...it is club like upstairs and yet has a great lounge atmosphere. The bar downstairs is my favorite though - it is simple and yet fun to sit at and chat with your friends or the bartenders, who are friendly and sociable. Another plus, is the drinks!  The cocktails are crafty and creative! 

They recently added another bar in the back lounge, called the James Polk Room. It's laid back with plenty of room to sit and the bartenders back there whip up all sorts of different cocktails based on your favorite spirit!
author: Yana N.

description: Came here for the first time last weekend and had a great time! The only thing I didn't like was that the boys were charged $5.. might deter my group from going in the future since other places are free. But I loved how big this place was! When I went to the restroom, i noticed a WHOLE back area completely unused with couches and tables! We hung out upstairs where there were two additional bars to the one downstairs, so there was never much of a wait at all. Everyone was dancing and they were playing great music (current EDM music) and we had so much fun!
author: Alexandra W.

description: The staff here is awesome. I can't even begin to describe what people have to face here. I do have to say that to have a dress code on a Friday night is outrageous. That said, you guys need to get your shit together.
author: Carlos C.

description: Playland is one of the few bars with a dance floor that isn't overly sleazy. Besides top 40, they also play lots of old-school hip-hop tunes (my favorite)! It's been pleasantly packed out both times I've been and the drinks are strong yet reasonably priced. But beware the occasional hordes of Jersey Shore-type men, ahhh!!
author: Tiffany W.

description: Nice cozy decor and ambiance for clubbing or hanging out. Free cover before 10 pm on a Saturday night that I went. Go straight to 2nd floor if you want to let loose on the dance floor. Get a little crowded after 11pm but that is when all the fun begins. The drinks are fine to me since I am not a heavy drinker. I would love to come back in the future.
author: Edmund F.

description: I love this place! This place reminds me of my favorite college bar back in the day.  If you are looking for a great, wild time on Friday or Saturday, this is where you need to go.  Some highlights include: 1) great music and good DJ, 2) fast bartenders, 3)  plenty of bouncers to keep stuff in check, 4) good looking people.  If you need a place to party on the weekend, come here.
author: Hanni S.

description:
The bouncers were really nice, even though we were being a pain in the ass :) 
Thanks for being awesome!
author: Himani A.

description: Prolly the best bar we went to last night on polk. I like the bartenders outfit.
author: Pickle R.

description: So my Friends and I went bar hopping on polk and this is by far one of best places we visited. There is an upstairs and downstairs and either way you go you can't go wrong. This is a good place to go if your looking to socialize and have a beer or a drink and just be in the city life but not go to crazy. The bartenders are all attractive so that's never a bad thing. I went around 10pm, no cover which was great and the bouncer was fun as we waited in line which made the wait feel shorter than it actually was. We went straight upstairs since everyone looked to get stuck downstairs. It became a bit challenging to get upstairs since everyone was right by the bar but just be a bit forceful you'll get through. The drinks are reasonable but there is a $20 minimum on credit cards which sucks because that's all I use. The shots looked pretty small from what I'm used to seeing but I didn't get one so it maybe the same amount I just didn't try it. They have tv's showing music videos of all modern music which is fun since you get to sing along when you know the song. It looked like there was a small dance floor towards the end if you want to dance a bit. Overall I liked this place if your looking to hang out, people watch, dance a bit and just have a drink and not end up to sloppy.
author: Kevin Z.

description: It gets really crowded during weekends, but is definitely a hot spot if you're looking to meet people. There's a bar on the street level and another one upstairs, along with a dancing floor. Music really depends by the DJ, so you might have good nights and not so good ones. It's a very nice addition to what Polk St. has to offer.
author: Steve E.

description:
I used to walk by Kimo's every day.  I think it is safe to say that daily I would say to myself "It is unlikely that I EVER walk through those doors no matter what the situation is".  
Well, they took down the "Kimo's" sign, hung one that said "Playland", I would also imagine they sterilized the place too, maybe twice, and that was enough to get me to walk in to have a beer or 4.  
I was given a tour of the new upstairs lounge, it wasn't done yet, but I can imagine it will be a great place to spend some time.  The stage is a good size, two big TV's in the back, one at the bar.  Most likely a great place to watch some football.  The sound system is great, bar has a lot to offer.  The best part is they installed windows upstairs so you can look down onto Polk Street.  It will no longer be what was most likely a dark.....scary place.
Bottom line, the beer was cold, bar tenders were attentive, that's all I can really ask.
author: Mike G.

description: I spoke with Playland's Manager, Chris, today and appreciate his prompt follow-up to my complaint about the excessive amount of iPhone theft that happens here. His customer service almost makes up for the lack of it I received from everyone else working that night. Thanks for the response, Chris.
author: Tori W.

description: Just discovered this place a few weeks ago and just fell in love. First, I like how clean this place is. The bartenders are hot, and I mean really hot and friendly. The owners are on the floor, making sure that the things are fine and everyone is enjoying their evening. Great drinks and great music. I was sold.
author: Felix G.

description: Good music. Bar downstairs, dance floor upstairs. Great for casual nights with friends. It can get a bit crowded upstairs, but that's probably because so many people love this place.
author: Lina M.

description: Another great addition to the neighborhood.  While I don't like how the old bars are disappearing, I do like it when improvements make the hood look better.  Clean, courteous, not overpriced and easy on the eyes.  Playland is a great new option on the Polk St. hike.
author: Corey V.

description: get rid of your $20 credit card minimum.  No other bars do it.  i guarantee you're NOT saving money with this policy...only creating a hassle for customers and your bartenders that have to find the card when people leave it.  THINK about whats good for the customer!
author: Mike K.

description: If you have a iPhone and want to get it stolen...come here! The music is great and the night was fun but on two separate occasions both me and my friend got our phones stolen out of our purses...Along with about 10 other girls in the same night. You would think the bar would try to do something or have additional security to control the situation but when we spoke to the bouncers about it they just laughed. Maybe it's an inside job? Regardless, you choose to go here don't bring you iPhone or keep it really close to you at all times.
author: Sarika G.

description: New bar on Polk that was much needed on this street... it's very modern and the upstairs portion is "loungey". It's two levels but actually feels more like two seperate bars - downstairs is smaller and more of a regular bar feel, upstairs is much larger with another bar and several couches and tables. There's also a small stage with two huge screens upstairs. The "Playland" connection was played up... by looking at the decor I would never get the theme park vibe. Regardless, this is a really nice place and I definitely plan to go back on a Friday or Saturday, seems like there will be a good crowd.
author: Gina C.

description: Awesome place))) the bartender is amazing!! The drink that Inna made is probably the best one I've ever had in my life))) will be back soon.. Really soon
author: Marina K.

description: This bar sucks. it's too crowded and it's too small and too many people are upstairs and on the dance floor.  I could hardly walk and get a drink at the bar when I was there. I won't be back anytime soon.
author: Brian B.

description: Small little dive bar.  Not a bad spot to meet a friend and have a drink....but definitely can't stay here too long.
author: Rishi S.

description: Great bar to go out to and dance! The bartender Julia was really awesome and took care of us. It got a little too crowded towards the end of night so we decided to leave. Overall, great experience!
author: Elaine K.

description: Playland is amazing!! two floors, two bars, dance space up top, no cover... very chill, upbeat, and good atmosphere for a bar. Not a typical dive bar in the city in that area. They also have great cocktails such as the yummy Strawberry Basil Martini...!! to die for :)
author: Kamilla N.

description: Came here with Friends on a Friday night, we had been meaning to check it out for quite some time. Got in smoothly, looks pretty cool, started a tab, getting loose...so far so good right? WRONG.  We were upstairs, had a table with great location. My friend goes downstairs to use the bathroom (only on the first floor) and there is a massive line just to get upstairs (I assume capacity issues). He tries to come back up and the bouncer says "back of the line buddy", He is shocked. He said I went to the bathroom , I have a table and a tab upstairs I literally just came down. He goes ya that's the policy, if you want to use the bathroom you have to get back in the line to get upstairs. He said it would be around 10-15 minutes. AMATEUR HOUR. I have never been anywhere with such a ridiculous policy. There are many things that I love about San Francisco and the west coast but when it comes to nightlife it really has it's head so far up its ass, in what world does such a policy make any sense? and if so how do you not have a bathroom on the second floor? You can't even get the cash together to put in one of those pathetic singles that SF is known for? Get real. This place sucks don't ever go.
author: Ben K.

description: Its a bar that wants to be a club...but they don't have the proper space, sound, or lighting. So its crowded and expensive like a club, but there's none of the upside. Worst of both worlds. Also, terrible top 40/hip hop/house mash up garbage. But you'll like it, because you have bad taste in music and just want to hear songs you know.  And crowded to the point of being hazardous is the only measurement you have of judging a good "club".  Meh... Oh yea, and good luck actually getting a drink.
author: Yan L.

description: Solid selection of scotch, creative cocktails and relatively decent priced drinks overall. SUPER CUTE, friendly and experienced bar tenders. The upstairs Dance floor, 2 full bars, dance floor satellite bar and big HD tvs kind of bring a unique twist to your everyday cocktail lounge/dance scene. Good music, too.
author: Jordan S.

description: Good place on Polk to go dancing to pop/top 40/electro.  Upstairs is pretty crowded.  Cover is $5 for dudes.
author: Matthew P.

description: Looove the second floor! It's a dance floor with good music, lit-up floor, and great views!
author: Amy L.

description: Upstairs has a great view of Polk street with floor to ceiling windows.  They have good drinks and a nice staff.  Couple of nice tv's to watch the game on and your good!  Lots of room upstairs too.
author: Shane B.

description: Jason was really great. He let us know exactly where the restroom was, and how to get there safely and have a fun time. Jason gave us good recommendations and good dressing tips.
author: Cayla P.

description: The bar is back open and I am looking forward to a manhattan with my favorite bartender.  Playland is a chill bar on Sun - Wed.  Big windows!!  On Thurs - Sat, it's chill till about 9ish and then it gets packed especially because of the music and the dance floor upstairs.   So you can chill and then go out, or you can chill and then join the party.  Either way, it's the place to go.
author: Enrico S.

description: Everything about this place seemed like an awesome place to go to from the outside: busy, good looking people and a good bar downstairs. But once you go upstairs to where the dancing and DJ are, it just went downhill for me. I might just be too old for this place but it not my thing with these 20 somethings being obnoxious and bumping in to me. However, the upside I definitely like the mix of music from hip hop, dance, top 40 to alternative - it was a nice change up. But that's about it!
author: LuLu M.

description: I've recently stopped drinking (it sucks that as you get older it takes longer to recover - I've decided it's not worth the time) and have been drinking boring things like orange juice or coke or water when at bars.  Imagine my delight in finding Marie at Playland.  The woman is a true mixologist.  She made me three different non-alcoholic drinks last night which were AMAZING.  I'd tell her one thing I liked (raspberries was the first, I think) and she would whip something up.  She'd test it, then add a little of this or that until it was, in her words, 'perfect'.  It was really something to watch - and drink.  Even if you drink, I'd say have her whip something up for you that isn't on a menu, or a known drink - you won't be disappointed.  I can't wait to see what she comes up with in the future - looks like I may become a regular (at least on the nights she works).  And guess what?  When there's no alcohol in a drink it's just as tasty and much cheaper!
author: Shelly R.

description:
Playland, a hip, new bar remains at a strong standing in my list of top 5 bars to visit when cruising around polk street. Not only did the atmosphere hold a fun and exciting vibe, it also was very inviting, I almost didn't want to leave! I would have to thank not only atmosphere, but also the bar tender Jessica, who took wonderful care of me while I was there. Jessica was attentive and "on the ball" when it came to the drinks. She was friendly and a blast to chat with, she really has mastered her craft! 

Well done Playland!
You will be sure to see me in the next coming week! 

Molly
author: molly c.

description: Probably my favorite Polk street bar.
author: Ally T.

description: I don't go out that often but I always enjoy my evenings at Playland. The bartenders are friendly and the cocktails are great. Definitely  check it out if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Rena N.

description: Super fun place! All the staff is really nice, the drinks are yummy, the music is really good and the crowed is pretty (but not obnoxious). Will definitely come back!
author: Vita V.

description: This place has great beer @ great prices. The bartenders are women and very friendly. It's all about happy hour. LAGUNITAS IPA $3/pint happyhour.
author: colin b.

description:
Playland is an awesome place specially because of the bartender Natasha. She takes really good care of all the customers and is very quick i getting your drinks. She experiments with new drinks and they come out fantastic.
I've been here on days she's not working and honestly it's a bit dull on those days, but still a great place to hang out and grab a few drinks with friends.
Overall a fantastic place. Cheers!!!
author: Harry S.

description: The space is really great, the drinks are even better and Natasha our bartender is as awesome as it gets, trust me.
author: Theodore S.

description: I just moved to the Nob Hill area and came across Playland. I tried it out for happy hour and loved it. Great venue with a happening vibe right on the corner of Polk and Pine. Had a great conversation with the bartender Natasha who was very friendly, courteous, and exhibited great  customer service. I will definitely be making this place one of my regular spots
author: Walter W.

description: I've been here about 5 times now and it's always been super fun.  I've been here on either Friday or Saturday nights and their DJ's are usually awesome.  The top floor gets a little too hot and all the windows are completely steamed up by 10:30ish but it's still super fun.  You can always go downstairs or outside to cool down.  I recommend you try this place if you enjoy dancing!
author: Eugenia S.

description: Great place to hang out with friends and grab a few drinks. Jessica is a rockstar behind the bar. Service is awesome and everyone is genuine and friendly, and the music is great.
author: Mag L.

description: Great cocktails, stumbling distance from my place, beautiful and charming female bartenders (all 10s except Natasha, who is a 10.5)...what else is there to say?  Playland is not the only bar I frequent, but it is my favorite bar in SF.  Please do not go here so I can have it all to myself.
author: Chris A.

description: came here on New Years day...the cocktails were over priced and it was waaaaay to hot inside...i didn't go upstairs...stood at the bar finished my drink and left. Won't be coming here again. Tragic Kimo's is gone....
author: SASHA B.

description: I was fortunate to be touring the Polk Street night scene with a veteran who knew about Playland.   This place sits on Polk Street in the heart of the fooding and drinking district.  In contrast to the neighboring bars, Playland has huge panoramic windows that give it a nice transparent feel.   A nice change from drinking in a windowless dive - of which there are numerous establishments to do just that nearby.   The bartenders appear to have been handpicked for, among other things, having well-conditioned hair - aesthetics are definitely important to the management.  Which fits with the well-groomed and appointment contemporary interior.  The lighting was nicely dim and well-planned.  As the evening went on, this place transitioned from a cheery loud crowd to almost a nightclub level of noise and activity.  The bartenders were super attentive, which on a busy night was very much appreciated.   Despite all the craze, they were constantly checking in and making sure we were good.  Great work, Playland bartenders - for that alone 5 stars! :-)
author: Jaydee B.

description: Douchey, B&T crowd...uppity, indifferent bouncers and bartenders....ridiculous wait time to get in AND to get upstairs once you're inside. Totally not worth it. Please...do yourself a favor, walk a block down, and go to Kozy Kar.
author: Kat M.

description: To be honest... I don't remember what occurred at Playland, but what does come to mind is Polk st. and a nice upstairs area. We got prime parking right outside and decided to mosey on in because the name was so appealing! Haha. Anyways, went upstairs and I was really impressed they had such a spacious upstairs with plenty of natural sunlight due to a million windows. I don't know what the crowd was like but that's because we were the only people upstairs which was nice....it was like a private party. Haha. Anyways my friends and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and would probably come here again.
author: Jackie M.

description: ex-kimos and much better. polk street which i love is spotted with a ton of dive bars which adds to its appeal. but this nice new little is a great addtion to add some diversity. i hate going to mayes and vertigo on the weekend bc lets face it....if i wanted to see the marina crowd i would go to the marina.... this crowd isnt as marina-ey but a nice little change. there is music on top which is a plus but it is also super packed. me and my friends ordered drinks at two different ends of the bar and ended up getting different prices for drinks...but then also different sizes....so who knows. i would dif like to make this a great pre-game spot but not stay too long as it gets really hot upstairs.
author: Ashley H.

description: Jessica was great! I wasn't drinking this particular day and went in playland for a refreshment and Jessica made me a stawberry and blackberry mix with a hint of mint that was exquisite. Thxx Jessica and props on the fresh ingredients playland!
author: mark n.

description: the classic basic-douche bistro combo. two stars only because the bartenders upstairs were super nice. unfortunately there were a shorter, and especially compared with san francisco standards quite fat woman among the security staff who arrogantly demanded to take off my hat, and threatened to kick us out if it won't happen in a timely manner, aka immediately. despite of all the vibrating super basicness of the place and the fact it became so packed you couldn't barely move your elbow without hitting someone's back, head and foot simultaneously, we could even have a good time there, if the arrogant control freak short fat pointy haired security micromanager woman is not yelling us vehemently about the no-hat policy multiple times. i don't see any chance to show up nor to recommend to this place to anyone, maybe only to people who has no sense of reality at all after an utterly failed lobotomy.
author: Tamas K.

description: Went to check this out on their soft opening and the place looked beautiful. Bar staff was very cool and distinctly remember them from some bar (I can't remember which) that i have been too on occasion. I suppose that means I drink a little too often... Oh well, place was still way worth checking out.
author: Matty R.

description: Natasha is a great bartender. Great spot to grab some good drinks. Will be going there again for sure.
author: Sparsha A.

description: i came here tonight while it was slow with not that many people and it was awesome. i meet Natasha and she makes some really good drinks! also very sweet and awesome person to talk to. very nice vibe and you cant go wrong. defiantly a good place to go and enjoy the night. the bouncer at the door definitely really cool to sit and have a chat with. i would recommend going here for sure!  its worth the time to go to if you haven't gone
author: Timothy R.
